Reviews.Title: 33% chance that you will have an unknown fault with this device & if you have chosen verizon wireless you will have a bigger one
Reviews.Author: AmusingGoat
Reviews.Content: We have a shared plan and we received 3 Samsung S4's. Two of these devices have no issue and we love the features but it is the one that does have issues that will do you in.As per our experience out of 3 phones 1 isn't functioning correctly. That's a rough 33% chance that you will end up with a problem like the one I am going to describe below.The Samsung S4 in question was brand new out of the box. There is a 14 day warranty that VZW provides that gives you that time to decide that you like that phone and so that there are no problems with the device. Let's face it folks it takes more than 2 weeks to start seeing problems with a device or at least to confirm it. Verizon wireless knows this or knew it at some point because that same type of warranty was 30 days a few years ago. Back to the device. This Samsung would freeze at day 20 and on every time we tried accessing the gallery or the camera. A battery would have to be pulled each time to get the phone to reset and when you go back to the gallery some of your pictures will be missing and the freeze happens again.Samsung is the only party to blame because this is their device, their manufacturing and q/a process. When you go to the store to spend an hour with tech associate to fix your phone they will determine that you have an unknown issue. They will remedy this issue by sending you a like new replacement device. We received this like new device and then within a few days the same issue has happen with freezing of gallery and camera. But here is the bonus: This second like new replacement that has been certified by VZW to be faultless and in perfect working order has just wiped blank our SD card and is experiencing the same problem as that brand new OTB device. After a week we had some free time so we trekked on back to our verizon store.The second trip was long over 2 hours in the store with a tech person who was unable to make the phone work. The result "We will send you a like new replacement in the mail" surely we will not have another faulty device.The replacement device arrives the next day and works for a few days. Then the gallery is not responding again. But for a even bigger slap in the face: this device froze and will not turn on again. No matter if you pull battery or not. It won't even indicate that the charger is in. Nothing, doesn't turn on or twinkle a light. Completely dead second like new certified replacement phone.Today I called customer service and was on a pointless call for almost an hour. I spoke to customer service then to tech support then to the supervisor of tech support who told me that they are sorry for all my problems with this device and they can send us a like new certified replacement phone as the only possible remedy.I'm sorry for expecting anything because there is no way they can send me a brand new phone that could possible have a 66% chance at fix my problem. The supervior's exact words were "We don't have any brand new phones to give you!" But they do have them to sell to you. So far the replacement like new phones that have been certified by VZW are a 100% failure to remedy my issue. The first 2 were complete failures, so how could this even be an option at this point. I am completely appalled at how Verizon has put these processes in place to make sure their bottom line doesn't shrink and to make their customers very unhappy and go through this much stress. What a shame! They were much more caring about their customers just a few years ago. This supervisor did not disagree with any of that was statement.Save yourself the headache and frustration.We people deserve to be treated better and deserve better service overall.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: The S4 is better than I thought....
Reviews.Author: Johnriii
Reviews.Content: after a ton of research for the past six months, I finally decided on the S4. being with verizon, I don't have a ton of choices, but the S3 and the Note 2 were at the top of my list up until the last month. my previous phone was the HTC Rezound and Thunderbolt, and battery life for either of those were very subpar, to say the least. I had also considered the  Razr maxx HD, with it's ginormous battery, but I really wanted something more future proof. when I found the price of the S4 was much more affordable than I thought it would be, I decided to research it as well. being with Verizon, we were the last to get it, so that contributed to the late decision I made. fast forward to now...this phone is AWESOME. the display is beautiful, the phone performs everything lightning fast, and with a minimizing case, (spigen slim armor)feels great to hold. without a case, it's somewhat slippery, which would probably be my only "con" of this phone. The battery life has been well above what I expected. for example, the first day I had the phone, I turned off GPS and bluetooth, turned on power saving mode, and unplugged it at 0630. at 1130 that night, i had 40% battery left. we're talking downloading apps, watching videos on youtube, playing candy crush dozens of times, and I had 40% left. I believe I have found my true love!!! phone calls are nice and clear, and s-voice is usable. most of the "gimmicks" work fine, but i really have no need for them most of the time, so I turn off what I don't use. Some people have issues with overheating, but I have had none of that. yes, it gets warm, but not this "I can't hold the phone" warm.  the S4 has exceeded my expectation in just about all aspects, and I feel that my $200.00 was very well spent.

Reviews.Title: Even Better Than We Had Hoped For
Reviews.Author: Hasan al-Basri "hasan"
Reviews.Content: After 7 years with a Motorola flip phone W755, which my wife and I dearly loved (and still work perfectly to this day), we decided to join the 21st century and get smartphones.Pros:1. Very fast with apps. The apps available (and automatically migrated from our Android Nexus 7 Tablets) are outstanding. Weather Radar, FreeNav USA, etc. Anything we already had installed on our tablets was instantly migrated to the S4 as soon as we went to the Play Store.2. Very intuitive to use if one is familiar with the Android O/S already.3. Outstanding voice search (google). I needed to find a UPS drop off store in another town. I was in the car, brought up Voice Search and spoke: "UPS Boone, Iowa". Up came a link to a Packaging store in Boone {that took both UPS and FexEX packages}, on a map and I could have navigated directly from that screen. Instead, I put the address into NavFree USA and it drove me right to it. Absolutely painless!3. Excellent tactile feedback to input, responsive and discriminating (not a lot of false data entry when typing, tapping or selecting).4. Gorgeous screen.5. Fast charge.6. Excellent Bluetooth compatibility: linked with over half a dozen devices without difficulty.7. Basic apps are useful (clock and alarms work just as one would expect)8. Multiple Home Screens make for easy app organization. I have all weather apps one one page, Playstore, Clock/Alarm, My Verizon Mobile and Camera on my "Main" Home Page, News apps like NY Times, The Young Turks, BeyondPod, Guardian on another page.9. Excellent battery life (as long as WiFi is turned off, and charges quickly. (under 1.5 hours for a full charge from about 20%).10. Phone coverage (Verizon) is outstanding, but Verizon always has been in our area.A Few Tips:1. Battery life is dramatically impacted with WiFi ON. When not needed, turn it off and you will get GREAT battery life.2. Get a really good/strong/armored case...don't go for aesthetics, buy a Beast. We like the Otter Defender Series. I feel safe with this case, period. Other cases I looked at were cosmetically attractive and quite obviously didn't protect from drops worth a darn. We have tile floors....end of discussion. The Otter Defender series puts the phone in a highly protective cocoon, with a very strong screen protector. It increases weight and bulk...but unlike many other aesthetically appealing cases, it actually protects your investment.3. If you use WiFi every day, be prepared to charge your phone nearly every day. We use it a lot, so charge our phones every night. One nice thing is that the batteries are user replaceable, inexpensive and readily available. You can even get a new back and an "extended" battery if you choose, BUT....that limits your choice of cases.4. If batteries are a problem, Sam's Club has a very nice 10,000 mah LI-Ion pack (very slim silver) for about $50.00 that you can charge via USB and will charge anything with a USB cable. This is a VERY handy device for charging multiple things. We use it for Ipod Touch, Nexus 7 Tablet, and of course, the S4.5.Lastly if you walk or run or otherwise exercise, I HIGHLY recommend the Motorola S11-HD Bluetooth Stereo Headphones. It is hot and humid in Iowa and walking about 5 miles a day puts a real burden on body temperature. These are very rugged, light and have excellent fidelity. They paired right up with the S4 in Media Mode. Single charge lasts several days of 2.5 hours per day use.In Summary: A great phone that is fast and versatile, requiring a rugged case and capable of just about anything sort of massage. A real pleasure to use and quite a bit of fun on top of that!

Reviews.Title: Flawed but better than the rest
Reviews.Author: Brian Kuhn "Wannabe teacher BK"
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research on this one and others, at one time I wanted the Iphone5, then I wanted the Droid DNA, then I wanted this phone, then I wanted the HTC one, but once I heard Verizon was not carrying the HTC one anytime soon I decided that the S4 was too expensive, and had memory issues so instead I thought I wanted the Nokia 928. Until one day I went into a Verizon store and these two phones happened to be side by side. I played with both phones, their cameras, UI and features. No contest, the S4 blew me away and blew the Nokia away. I don't care that the Nokia is the best low light phone because its video and regular photos cannot touch the S4 and the UI is flat and cheap compared to Touchwiz. Then one day I heard big red was going to get the HTC one, so I figured I better try that out before I commit to the S4. I played with one in an AT&T; store, I was not that impressed. It may have more pixels that the S4 but you would never know by looking at them, the S4 has the best looking screen on the market. HTC's news feed is really not that much better than Flip board and it is better to have widget than an entire screen taken up by a news feed. The 4 ultrapixel thing is a gimmick, the HTC one can't produce near the detail of the S4 on anything more than 10 feet away. The S4 seems like a more fun phone, more fun that the HTC one and WAAAY more fun than the Iphone 5, the most boring OS of all time.Breakdown:Screen, the screen is amazing colors pop and there is no pixels to be seen, it looks like somebody printed a glossy pic on each screen.Sound, great with my skull candy, but a mediocre speaker that just sounds audible in my car.Air gestures, works very well, great for moving apps from screen to screen, nice for web use and checking your gallery.Smart view, the eye thing is a joke, it constantly loses your eyes.Features, I love the TV remote option it is so easy to set up, story book is real nice, and the multitasking and two app feature works very well.Memory, Android recently made it so you move apps to the SD card but not all of them, you can delete unwanted factory apps which is nice, but one day I am gonna root this baby!Speed and games, some lag, but moves fast and sharp even while the RAM is all used up. Games look and move amazing.Customization, no phone is better than this one for that!S-voice and Drive, S drive is great if the phone can actually hear you!!! which is rare....S-voice is garbage, one win for the Iphone and Suri. However, Google voice is near perfect, google should of worked on S-drive as well.I love this phone!!!!

Reviews.Title: S4 is FANTASTIC!  I love this phone!
Reviews.Author: R. Davis
Reviews.Content: There are better, more researched, and far more detailed reviews out there so I'm not going to repeat what's been done already.  Suffice it to say, I used those reviews to come to my purchasing decision anyway.  I was split between spending fifty bucks on an S3, which also had great reviews and had a well established track record, or two hundred on this bad boy.  I don't like being the first one buying new technology as there are almost always bugs in the system (think about all the issues each new iPhone comes with).  But after a month I couldn't wait any longer.  Most reviews were overwhelmingly positive at that point.  Many that weren't were often so inane that you had to wonder if the author was high, mentally handicapped, or an Apple plant.  So I pulled the trigger and bought one and I have been in Heaven since!I was coming from a Droid X, which was nice, but SLOW and a little buggy at times.  And the older it got the more problems I was having with it.  I liked the Motorola build quality and interface and considered the Razr Maxx HD, but all the buzz was on this phone and the more I looked into it, the more there was to love about it.  Namely:  1) the screen is big, bright, and beautiful; 2) the battery is HUGE and lasts all day (it is physically 4 times bigger than the Droid X battery); 3) the phone is very fast; 4) the S Voice app (a Siri knockoff) is cool; 5) there are many new features I haven't even begun to tinker with yet, but look promising.All in all, an excellent phone.  As this is also a very expensive phone, you HAVE to protect it against the inevitable drops.  I used an Otterbox Defender on my old Droid X and that protected me from many falls.  At first I tried a smaller case this time and a belt clip holder that could accommodate the extra size of the case.  The case came highly rated, but it was soooo small compared to the Otterbox I just couldn't imagine it handling everything I threw at the Otterbox.  So after about a week with the other case I purchased the Otterbox anyway and am glad I did.  The Defender series on this phone is actually smaller in dimensions than it was for my old Droid X.  It uses different rubber and is a vast improvement.  And I have so much more confidence in just handling my phone.  The other case was so small and thin I was handling it as delicately as if it had no case at all.  Just too stressful!!

Reviews.Title: Stay away from this phone unless you want to buy another one in 6 months
Reviews.Author: David R. Schoenbrun
Reviews.Content: When it happened to my friend, I thought it was user error, but when it happened to me 3 weeks later, I had to apologize to him for not believing him.There is a design flaw in this phone, that causes the layer under the glass to crack, and renders the phone unusable. If you look up Samsung Galaxy S4 glass problems on the internet, you will see a slew of reports where people say the same thing. They put the phone in their pocket and when they took it out, it was cracked and not working.At first, it looks like there the glass is broken, but under further inspection, yo can see that the micro layer underneath the glass that does the display, has been stressed and cracked. It always seems to happen in the same place, the top rght side near the camera lens.Avoid purchasing this phone, or you will be left 6 months later needing to use the insurance or pay 200 bucks for a replacement

Reviews.Title: I loved this phone until it broke.
Reviews.Author: Mike in San Diego
Reviews.Content: I love this phone.  It does everything well and is fun to use.  It has so many features I doubt if I will ever figure them all out - be sure to download the manual.  BUT!!! The phone fell out of my pocket when I was bending over and fell on to a carpet from about 18 inches and the screen cracked.  It still works, but looks awful.  A Google search revealed that this is a very common occurrence.  I would have thought that "Gorilla" glass wouldn't be so fragile. It will cost as much to fix as I paid for the phone in the first place.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, so far
Reviews.Author: M. Walker "Arcana"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Samsung after two Motorola phones.  I had been relatively happy with my Motorola Droid Bionic I'd had for two years, but felt let down by Motorola after seeing the specs on their new phones - the Ultra, Maxx, Moto X, etc.  The Bionic had 1) Removable battery (I used the extended battery), 2) HDMI out (used it all the time), 3) Micro-SD slot (I have a 64GB card), and 4) the Motorola Lapdock as an option, which I bought once it came down in price to about $80.  The new Google/Motorola apparently decided that all of what I liked about Motorola phones was unimportant therefore I decided that staying with Motorola was unimportant in return. The Moto-X has some nice features to be sure, but what it doesn't have  were deal-killers for me.  And I really don't give a crap about ordering a teal phone with white accents; it's a bleeding phone, not a pair of shoes - I just want black.What I like about Samsung is 1) Removable battery, 2) Micro-SD slot, 3) multi-generational accessories 4) an eco-system of 3rd party accessories - what you get when you are a high volume phone. 5) Frequent OS updates and fixes.In terms of the device itself, it is 1) Very fast, 2) Excellent screen, 3) Very good camera, 4) Reasonable battery life.  By "reasonable", that is saying that it is not as long as my Bionic with the extended (2600mAh) battery, but maybe 80% of that.  But because of the removable battery, I can also go to a 5200mAh option Hyperion Samsung Galaxy S4 5200mAh Extended Battery + Black Back Cover (Compatible With ALL Samsung Galaxy S 4 Models) [18 Month Warranty] **NOW WITH NFC / Google Wallet** if I so choose, at the cost of some thickness.  I moved over my 64GB Micro-SD card and it picked up all my media without any reformatting. Everything else so far works well - Bluetooth is solid, WiFi is solid, the IR blaster could use a bit more juice, but does work.  In terms of all of the gadgety motion/gesture stuff,  I've turned it off - it kept picking up unintentional commands and that drove me batty.  Other things like NFC I've yet to try - this phone is stuffed with features.The accessories I've bought, like the iBOLT xProDock Active Car Dock/Holder/Mount for Samsung Galaxy S3, S4 & Note 2. Works with ALL cases. USB cable for charging., work well and are multi-generational, so I have some hope to use them with my next phone.  Note to manufacturers:  you want lock in to your brand, make the accessories work moving forward.  If not, well, see comments about Motorola above.That's all for now - I'll add more as I try more things.

Reviews.Title: Why you want THIS phone in particular
Reviews.Author: Pecos Bill
Reviews.Content: Why the Galaxy S4 and not, say, the HTC One?  I think there's two big reasons:1) You can replace the battery.  Similar to older cellphones, the Galaxy S4 continues the trend of the replaceable battery.  Actually you may not care about this if you buy a new phone every 2 years and throw your old one away but if you want to resell it or keep it longer, then the ability to replace the battery will become important -- rechargables eventually wear out.  A lot of newer phones (like the HTC One) are building the battery integrated -- you can't replace it.2) It has a slot for an SD card.  Again, some newer phones are bucking this trend and launching with internal storage but no SD card slot.  The Galaxy S4 comes with 16 GB of internal storage but also has an SD card slot.  When I upgraded from the Thunderbolt I just moved over my SD card and bam, all my music and pictures were on the card and moved with me.  It's also a lot more storage to use for videos and so forth.Incidentally, if you're on the fence about a new phone and currently have a 3G phone, you really want to upgrade to 4G if they have it in your area (which, statistically, they probably do -- ask your carrier).  4G means your phone can browse and download as fast as a home broadband connection.  It's a huge improvement and really makes the phone into a useful internet device even away from wifi connections.As for the phone itself, all I can say is I'm really impressed.  I can find no drawbacks to this phone.  I like the size, I like the feel of it, it still fits in my pocket, the battery life is good, the interface is slick and easy to understand.  I like that they added pop-up explanations for a lot of the features (but there are some that are still mysterious and you'll have to look them up to see what they do).  The Verizon phone came with "bloatware" but I'm having a harder time faulting them this time.  A lot of it does things I typically download apps for anyway, like turning on the flashlight or taking notes or maintaining a list of calendar events, so no irritations so far.Actually, there is one thing the S4 did that annoys me, which I'm going to list purely in the vague hope that some Samsung engineer reads it one day: they put the charging port on the bottom of the phone.  This means I can't prop the phone upright with my kickstand and have it charging, as I could with my Thunderbolt (where the charging port was on the side).Anyway, that's just a minor quibble.  Overall I'm really happy with this phone and feel it's a good upgrade over my previous HTC Thunderbolt.I've used the HTC One, HTC One X and HTC DNA a fair amount (work phones) and they don't have as many whiz-bang features but I also didn't like that I couldn't replace the battery or insert an SD card.  So when it came time for my personal phone upgrade, I got the Galaxy S4 and love it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic and fast
Reviews.Author: Dan "A/V Man"
Reviews.Content: I have to say the hand motions are cool, but the best features are that it stays on as long as you are looking at it, and it has voice controls for everything.  Just set it down, say Samsung Camera, then shoot and it takes beautiful pictures.  All my calls have been clear and loud.  I was afraid it would be flimsy with the plastic cover, but it is very solid.  PLUS, a phone with a removable battery and SD card?!?  Genius!

Reviews.Title: no sim card included best cell phone I have had.
Reviews.Author: P. harty
Reviews.Content: only had the phone one day and love it1 I will have a better review in awhile. I just wanted to let people know that this phone does not come with a sim card. I upgraded from a droid and of course the sim card is a different size. so I had to take it to a Verizon store and they will put in the sim card for free and activate the phone for free also. you cannot activate the phone without a sim card.Well after a few weeks with the phone I gotta say I am very impressed! As with anything there are things I do not like about the phone but other people may find them useful. Most importantly this phone is fast. whether it be playing with apps or surfing the net its very fast! The WiFi also is excellent as is the Bluetooth! I love the nearby devices feature Samsungs DLNA. It took a bit to realize that photos, music and videos wind up in your gallery in the nearby devices folder. But you can share throughout your home network! Excellent! S beam is pretty much a useless feature for me This is the only Samsung product I have so sharing with another Samsung device is pretty much unnecessary. And I really dont know alot of people with a Samsung phone to make it worthwhile. NFC (near field communication) Also pretty much worthless to me there just are not alot of products out there that have this so not worth having right now. Others might find S beam and NFC very cool features though.The gallery seperates everything! camera,downloads,nearby,video,videorecord,screenshots,Facebook folders and autobackup if you have it. Basically any program or app has a folder. KIK whatever. Real nice. The camera is fantastic! Both video and still cam. Love taking snapshots while taking a video. The only thing I have had trouble with is streaming video shot from the phone camera to my tv? it keeps freezing up? but other videos stored on the phone play great? pics and music come across fantastic too! I do not like the Samsung KIES WiFi. It is basically a program that you load on your computer where you can share everything with your phone and computer. You can either USB your phone or its supposed to work on your WiFi. I cannot get it to work with WiFi? I figure a phone like this should work like a Wiz sharing files wirelessly. Why would I USB it? anyways I could not do anything over the WiFi It said my phone was connected but I could share nothing? I have plenty other programs I can use for this so no big deal I uninstalled Kies WiFi from the computer. I found it slow and buggy. Maybe thats something Samsung can work. When you can use the nearby devices to share whats the point? There is also Kies Air. It is kind of a dashboard of your phone you install on your computer. You can look at call logs send and recieve texts from any computer its kinda your phone on your desktop. I do like this however I did have a couple issues. Once its on your computer a screen pops where you have to put in a 4 digit code that is generated from your phone.The problem is everytime you use it you have to go through this? and once again this is all wireless connection and still no way to share files? The air gestures are very cool the voice commands work great and one neat thing I noticed I have a network extender at my house and the phone tells me when its connected. As far as people raving about the battery? I find it good but by the end of the day its gone. Sometimes it doesnt make it that far. The car charger is a must. So I barley scratched the surface of all this phones features and tricks it will take you awhile to figure things out but damn its so worth it! I really love this phone. with the few things I dont like about it others will find them great! I highly recommend this phone!!! Best cell phone ever!

Reviews.Title: My first Smart phone and I am loving it
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Very Very nice.  I have had no problems with is product.  It hooks up to my router easily and my parents router easily.  The pictures are crystal clear.  It does what I want when I want.

Reviews.Title: Best phone ever!
Reviews.Author: Rory Lalor-Molero
Reviews.Content: Ive been surrounded by iphone users at work for years and this phone makes all of them jealous. Its got a big bright gorgeous screen, great battery life, amazing camera.It has a lot of gimmicky features that most people will use sparingly, but the core features are superb.i cant recommend this phone enough, even to users of the galaxy s3 who say my phone looks even better and faster than theirs.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with the phone.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Very fast processor compared to the (Motorola Droid X) it replaced. My only complaint is the amount of "bloat ware" installed on the phone that consumes almost half of the phones internal 16G storage.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This phone is about as close to a five star product as their is, but since nothing is perfect here are the negatives:--home screen doesn't rotate, until you enter an app it only displays in portrait mode--So much bloatware that is nigh on impossible to remove without a high level of technical proficiency--"settings" and "back" key are too easy to accidentally press when holding in landscape view--home screens don't "wrap around" so when you reach the last home screen you have to swipe the other direction to get back to the first.As far as the positives, just about everything else.  Highly customizable, great display, fantastic camera.  No installed flash, but there's an easy workaround.  In fact, there seems to be an easy workaround for just about any issues you might encounter.  Great phone.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressive Phone (Replaced my iPhone)
Reviews.Author: malom
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is an amazing and beautiful phone.  I replaced my older S3 with the S4 and was instantly impressed.  Every feature of the phone seems to be well thought out and designed.  Button placement is perfect and phone seems very well constructed.  I do have a few minor issues, but they are all with the Verizon UI.  Verizon has changed some things from the stock UI that may be annoying.  When I saw the S4 in a store the home screens wrapped around, but this is not the case on my device.  After doing some research, I have learned that the Verizon UI is slightly different but this feature does exist by default on AT&T.;  However, that doesn't change my love for this device!

Reviews.Title: Good phone but Fraglie
Reviews.Author: Dan Maude
Reviews.Content: Yes, yes it is a wonderful smart phone, fast with a beautiful screen. But do not put it in your pocket, as the combo of the larger screen and the plastic back cover makes this phone a little too flexible, and it can easily lead to a cracked screen. While this is not considered a manufacturer's defect, and you will not be able to return the phone, it is a serious design flaw. This phone breaks with the "abuse" of putting it in your jeans pocket and driving to work.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone, great replacement.  Some issues
Reviews.Author: M.D.C. "Tempting Reviews"
Reviews.Content: I won't bore you.  Bullet time:SCREENAmazing.  You cannot tell it's Pentile.  Anyone who says they can is analyzing it with a microscope and criticizing it unfairly.  The device has a beautiful screen.  HOWEVER...and this will only affect you if you're coming from like a HTC DROID DNA (Verizon Wireless) or similar device with a true HD LCD screen... everything appears blown up, apparently to help you read things on screen.  From the menus to the TouchWiz pulldown.  It's not a negative for those who like to make sure they can see things properly without zooming or squinting.  But it was too much for me, having come from devices with smaller elements.INTERFACEFace it, TouchWiz is terrible.  Fine for the newbie Android user.  Not so fine for someone who's used to Android looking and feeling a certain way.  It just loses that Jelly Bean experience in my opinion.  While it's not as blatantly forced as with, say, the Samsung Fascinate No Contract Cell Phone 3G Android Smartphone Verizon, it's still there and obvious.  Downloading a customized launcher like Nova Launcher or MIUI helps a lot to clean this up.  Unfortunately the Settings "menus" are simply horrible and unintuitive to deal with.  It would have been much better to keep with one menu rather than trying to break things out and forcing you to hunt for what you want.  The Developer option is also hidden which is the only way to disable some of the blurring and animations that slow the phone down.  I didn't see TouchWiz slowing things down at all, though.  It's just an annoying interface for those that like a customized experience (the whole reason to go Android in the first place).AUDIOSo primarily, I do Bluetooth audio.  There it does perfectly fine.  I had no issues with how the music or call quality sounded.  Where I was a bit disappointed was with the speakerphone.  It doesn't sound "robotic" but it doesn't sound clear, either.  Muddy is a good way to describe it.  It's a loud speaker, but just not clear.  There's a lot of distortion that happens at the highest levels.  This isn't the case on phones such as the Motorola DROID RAZR HD (Verizon Wireless), but then that phone comes with a decent equalizer.  I'll hae to get one for the S4, but I hate having to do that.CAMERAI'm quite pleased with the camera quality on the S4, both video and photo - except that I found that the Auto photo setting literally trashes the image for whatever reason.  If you want quality, choose anything else, but not that one.  HDR does a decent job, but I found that either the Perfect Face or Night settings do a better job when dealing with variable lighting.  The flash is quite powerful, capable of capturing things clearly even in the darkest of conditions up to a few feet.  Beyond that and you're of course out of luck.  As far as the video camera, both the rear and front facing do a pretty good job.  The front facing is clearer than on most phones, except that the color is muted.  Decent enough for video calls in normal lighting.  I've recorded video reviews with the S4 that rival camcorder quality in terms of clarity and audio.BATTERYBattery life under normal (i.e. you're not texting your BFF 16 hours a day) conditions can net you between 15 and 24 hours.  That's assuming you're at least partially on Wi-Fi.  Even if you're only on Wi-Fi for 4 hours out of the day, you should still be able to pull 15 hours out of the phone.  That's with brightness, GPS, 4G and Bluetooth on, mind.  I will caution you - DO NOT accept the Google Play Services upgrade.  It will destroy your battery due to a bug.CALL QUALITY/SIGNAL STRENGTH/RECEPTIONIt cannot match the sheer epic that is the RAZR MAXX HD, but it'll do.  Far better than anything Sony put out, for sure.  There's no delay, no echo, no "robotic" that I could tell.The two letdowns:- For the price, Samsung definitely should have thrown in an SD card.  Period.  There was no excuse for this exclusion.  If Motorola could do it with the RAZR, Samsung could and should have.- Samsung advertises "wireless charging", but the phone doesn't come with that capability.  You're forced to spend an extra $100 after launch (Samsung Galaxy S4 Wireless S Charger Kit (inductive type) - Wireless Charging White Cover & Pad)  For functionality that should have been included.  Worst case, include the battery cover with the phone at launch for free but then offer the charging pad for those that want it.Other than that I don't have complaints.  The people complaining about build quality are iPhone/HTC fanatics who think that aluminum is the only "quality".  For me, as long as the thing doesn't creak, I'm good.  This one doesn't creak nearly as bad as, say, the BlackBerry Storm 2 9550 Unlocked Phone - No Warranty.  So I'm good.

Reviews.Title: Great smart phone, but FRAGILE -Protect it!!
Reviews.Author: K. Wessling "Wiley Retired Prof"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my S4 about 7 weeks ago from Costco.  There was a soft case provided that I was concerned about providing enough protection.  Six weeks later my concerns were justified. My phone, which was in my left front pocket, got pressure against its' face as I got out of my car and the screen cracked.  Fortunately I had gotten an insurance plan and it only cost me $25 for a refurbished replacement phone.  I learned the hard way that smart phones and particularly the Galaxy S4 are much more fragile than flip phones or phones with smaller LCD displays.  The size of the Galaxy S4 screen is a mixed blessing.  It allows a lot of viewing area, BUT it makes the phone much more easily damaged.  The large screen adds to fracture vulnerability since pressure on the screen from a hard surface (like a car door frame) can easily put enough stress on the screen to fracture the glass.  I also learned how easy it is to break an S4 just by having it in your pocket.I would suggest three precautions to help protect your S4: 1) Purchase a breakage protection plan to protect you from having to replace the phone early in your contract period for its' full price, 2) protect it with a rigid case that protects the edge of the screen from point pressure and adds resistance to the phone flexing on its' long axis.  3) If you must put the phone in your pocket face the screen toward your thigh and be very careful NOT to let your thigh push the phone against hard surfaces.

Reviews.Title: My unit was defective
Reviews.Author: WonTonSoup
Reviews.Content: Had a defective unit, would randomly crash and restart itself about 5 times in one hour. Never installed any apps or rooted it. Also would not maintain USB connection with the computer. Otherwise when it worked it was really nice, was fast, and the display was crisp. Loaded with a ton of apps, most I wont ever use and cant uninstall, but you can still disable them. Though the size is a tad large for it to be uncomfortable to pull in/out of my pocket when sitting in the car. Had sent it back for a refund and will now look for another phone that's more to the size of Droid X.

Reviews.Title: My favorite phone
Reviews.Author: Judith Hart
Reviews.Content: This review is from: Samsung Galaxy S4, Black Mist 16GB (Verizon Wireless) (Wireless Phone)This phone is very nice. I like that it has a big screen and a decent battery life. I think that this phone is more advanced than most. The only complaint I have is if you are buying it without a phone contract, it is really expensive.

Reviews.Title: Flimsy but otherwise great.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I loved this phone, but one day the LCD screen cracked while in my front empty pocket. I babied this awesome piece of hardware.The glass and phone had no signs of wear, and a google search will verify this is not a one in a million problem, but many customers have had the same experience.Samsung says it is under warranty but charges $200 plus shipping to fix it. Samsung customer service is very poor. If you contact them they just say it's your fault. Considering the overwhelming success brought by this phone, which have likely brought an increase in production would have yielded a more reasonable repair cost for a defective product.

Reviews.Title: Amazing phone
Reviews.Author: buyer_inVA "VA buyer"
Reviews.Content: I had the Droid 2 Global that had a slide out keyboard and I was really planning to find another keyboard option.  This phone, works beautifully and I don't have any issues typing or texting.  It rotates sideways for a long wide keyboard.  Very clear images, great speaker phone, easy navigation.It does have a bunch of junk preloaded that burns a ton of power.  If you go into your settings, select the more button at the top of the screen and then look below for the Application Manager button (a blue square with for white cubes in it).  From there you will see all your apps listed by downloaded, on SD Card, Running, or All.  You reach these by sliding your finger left or right across the screen.  If you select running you will be able to see how much power each app is using.  Under the "All" tab, you can select the app you want and either force stop it or "Disable it".  If you disable it, it will no longer show up on your regular phone apps list and it won't run any power.  You can always go back in here to enable it again if you want it.  By disabling a bunch of apps I didn't want to use, I found my phone would now last for 2 days of use rather than 1/2 a day of use without a charge.

Reviews.Title: awesome phone
Reviews.Author: loff
Reviews.Content: Just over a week now and so far I am very impressed. At first I was concerned about the back of the phone, it seemed like flimsy plastic. But it actually holds up fine. And quite frankly, I really don't spend much time looking at the back of the phone. The 5 inch screen is incredibly sharp. The colors just jump out. The speed is also incredible. At least on the Verizon service, not sure about the others. The camera is also excellent. It is a full feature camera that actually takes great pictures. I purchased a 32 gig smicro card for $23 so I don't need to worry about taking pictures at 13 megs. Overall the phone works great, no dropped calls, talk to text works well, and there are endless features to discover. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I feel like I am supposed to treat this more like a tablet than a phone because of it's size. WIth the Otterbox it's huge but I love it. The sound quality is amazing through my car speakers and during phone calls. 4G is so fast where available. The only problems I have with the phone are the broken apps I have tried using in the app store.

Reviews.Title: Totally worth it.
Reviews.Author: Derrick Hallager Jr
Reviews.Content: Great screen sizeGreat battery lifeGreat performanceAnd most importantly expandable memorySuch an improvement over my thunderbolt I can overlook touchwiz and how much memory it takes up.

Reviews.Title: Just switched from iPhone
Reviews.Author: DougDTX
Reviews.Content: I decided I needed to learn a little about the other side of the mobile phone world. This phone is crazy fast... a bit overkill. If you're an iPhone fan, and you don't like a lot of settings or ability to customize, then just stay with the iPhone. If you're ready to take things to the next level, go with the S4. After 1+ week of heavy use, no regrets so far.

Reviews.Title: From A Motorola Lover
Reviews.Author: LO127
Reviews.Content: Samsung Galaxy S4, Black (Verizon Wireless)I was hesitant at first about buying a Samsung product but I am very happy so far. The only thing I have a problem with is the phones ability to communicate with the home PC. Once you get it setup right though you have several choices of programs to use. Samsung has a lot of functions that you thought that you would never need but I have used several of them and love the way that it makes life easier.

Reviews.Title: Awsome! especially the camera.
Reviews.Author: Monica Kim "MK"
Reviews.Content: I normally don't like spending $200 for a phone...after all, phone is a phone to me, a device that is used to call someone but upon reading about this new phone's camera functions plus the awsome resolution, I had to get it.  I have 2 little ones that I contantly take pictures of and the camera that comes with the phone is just amazing with so many functions.  I especially like the fuction where it allows you to tak multiple pictures at once and pick the best one.  It's nice since my littles ones never sit still for picturs.  With the Instagram and all, most of my pictures look like regular camera pitures not pictures taken with a phone.  Plus there is no lag time so what you take is what you get.  Videio function is really good as well...bright...fast and crisp.I highly recommend this phone just for the camera function alone.  God knows what more fucntions are available in this phone but I am sure I won't use any of them.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: TheGuy
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this phone.  I love the Galaxy S series... they haven't let me down yet.  Each iteration gets better and better.

Reviews.Title: Galaxy S4
Reviews.Author: JAMES HOFACKER
Reviews.Content: Best phone i ever had. Have a Galaxy S2 for 2 years. S4 is 4 times faster, and little taller.update. had phone a week and a half. works every where all the time. better antena? battery lasts 2 days easy. s2 needed charge 2 times aday. have no complaints so far. does everything but laundry.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Ashton
Reviews.Content: I've been patiently waiting for this phone's release and I'm so glad that I wasn't impatient and bought the s3 instead.  I'm still learning the ins and outs of the phone, but so far the picture quality is stellar, it's fast (incredibly so) and even the sound quality is great!  I previously owned a Motorola Droid 3, so I'm having to get used to a touch screen keyboard, but even when you're blatantly spelling a word wrong (because you're hitting the wrong key) it assumes variations of the word you're typing and you can just select that.  I've noticed it also assumes words based on the content of your message so far.The only complaint I have deals not with the phone, nor Verizon, but with Amazon.  Amazon doesn't explicitly tell you the phone does not come with a SIM card (at least not that I could find).  Having not had a phone for a while that required a SIM card, I figured this was something that would come with the phone automatically.  But, I learned from Verizon that third-party sellers (I don't know if it's all) do not ship the SIM card.  However, it's an easy problem to fix if you have a Verizon store nearby.  You can get the SIM card at no cost.

Reviews.Title: Good but VERY fragile!
Reviews.Author: RoniB "RoniB"
Reviews.Content: I like several of the features on this phone, and it has a wonderful large display compared to my Razr.... but it is so FRAGILE. Over my two years, i have dropped that Razr a thousand times -- onto tile, hardwood, concrete. The outside is dinged up a bit, but still completely intact and totally functional.With this S4, all it took was ONE drop, and about a quarter of the screen was shattered. It still works, though i got a plastic screen shield to protect my fingers. Then, once the glass was weakened, it was down hill from there. Another drop onto a hardwood floor shattered another corner.Again, everything still works, but the glass is practically pulverized in a few places.I knew i was clumsy, but i never realized just how good i had it with my Razr.

I am sure these can be upgraded with software over due course.Air View and Air Gestures - are they worth it? Air view is similar to how the S-pen on the Galaxy Note 8 works. This works with many of Samsung's built-in apps, including the photo gallery, the dialer, Samsung's browser and email client. It also works with Flipboard. Air View works by cranking up the capacitive sensor on the screen. Another new feature is Air Gestures. This uses the IR sensor on the top of the phone to detect movement by your palm or finger. One can flip between open tabs in Samsung's browser app, skip to a new song in the music player and do many other things. Reviews.Title: Excellent phone
Reviews.Author: Mark Silbert
Reviews.Content: Coming from a Motorola Razr Maxx, this phone is definitely an upgrade. The screen is large, bright and sharp and the software integration is wonderful. Everything is better than the Maxx except for 2 things: battery life and radio signal. I expected to lose some battery life when I moved to this phone and I did. However, it's not bad, just noticeably less. For radio signal, I like to stream music as I work out in the gym. For some reason, I don't get strong signal in my gym. In the case of my old Maxx, I could stream music or video with hardly ever getting buffering. With my S4, it do get buffering, especially when streaming video.The Maxx was constructed like a tank whereas the S4 is plasticy. After having both, I'm not convinced that tank construction is better. I bought an Otterbox for my S4 and like the feel better than the Maxx.One the plus side, the camera takes excellent pictures. The phone loads apps faster and just seems much less buggy. Configuring apps and the phone itself is much better on the S4. I also really like that the S4 has a mechanical home button instead of a capacitive button.As far as making phone calls, I think the S4 sounds excellent. I've read reports that say the Maxx is clearer and louder, but I don't agree. The Maxx may get a stronger signal but it doesn't sound any clearer. I think the S4 has more volume and sounds better. This is especially noticeable when a call is placed on speakerphone. The Maxx was loud but sounded distorted at high volume. The S4 gets just as loud with minimal distortion. I also like that the S4 phone app has large buttons for the dialpad, muting, speakersphone, etc.I believe the S4 is the best phone you can get for the Verizon network!

Reviews.Title: Screen cracks easily.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A OHare
Reviews.Content: Very nice device but the screen cracks very easy find this very disappointing. maybe samsung should got back to the drawing board on this problem happened to my son, grandson and husband so 3 out of 4 phones had to be replaced at over a hundred dollars each.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Larry Van Syoc
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why anyone would want to put this phone down, it is fantastic as far as I am concerned.  After all the reviews I have read, it appears that the biggest complaint is the battery life, or what I, personally, have read.  My phone shows a battery life of an average of 54 Percent after 2 days of use.  I have yet to see any phone that I have ever owned top this.Everything else about this phone is nothing but pure fun and interesting.  It is amazing to me what this phone is capable of.  I have yet to see anything like it and I haven't even scratched the surface of all the features this phone has and is capable of yet.  I am still working on it.I would recommend this phone to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Allen
Reviews.Content: I feel a little dumb for buying this for two reasons... #1 the S5 is about to come out, and #2 the white one was cheaper.  But my tax refund said I wanted this instead of repainting my car because I had an epiphany one morning.  I like Samsung... I own a Galaxy Tab 3 8.0" and I had a Galaxy Stellar for a little over a year, and it served me well.  It took the extended batteries, the pocket wear with no screen protector, flying across the seat of my car, the accidental (and on purpose at times) drops from waist height, the overloading of apps I never use, the sweat and rain... But the microphone didn't work anymore and it had grown to hate me.  I woke up one day and decided to check the weather and the phone crashed and reset itself for the millionth time.  I had the overwhelming urge to throw it against the wall, stomp on the pieces, and then shoot whatever was left with a shotgun.  I didn't do any of that, because I immediately ordered this phone, which I've been wanting ever since it was announced.  Yeah, it's expensive out of contract, but I'm telling you it saved lives.Anyway, kidding aside... This phone has more than enough space for whatever you need and a bunch of crap you don't, and the quad core 1.9ghz processor is a beast compared to a lot of what's on the market right now.  I have had no problems running anything I've thrown at it so far including 3d RPGs at max settings, PS1/N64 emulators, multiple apps or media conversions... All while leaving it on power saver mode (which throttles the CPU) and effectively lasting through my work day plus some on one stock battery (I have 2 backups just in case).  Before you say "well that's not very long for one battery" let me add that I'm pretty much constantly using this phone at work whether it's texting or calling in relation to work, or checking my FB and firing up those emulators so I can find something more irritating than whatever I'm trying to accomplish at the moment.

Reviews.Title: $699 smartphone for $49? --ya gotta be kidding me
Reviews.Author: Fluffy
Reviews.Content: so i spent 1-2 hrs comparison shopping for a phone/carrier. saved $650 and got fantastic phone. you dont need manual. they send start up pamphlet to insert SIM card and extra GB if you bought it and the battery they sent. Tell you how to sign off and on and then you just teach yourself for what you want it to do and what you want it to save you money on--just like when you select carrier and plan. I did the whole transaction and never  saw any face except the delivery guy. That's my kind of shopping!

Reviews.Title: Solid phone
Reviews.Author: John S Lemire
Reviews.Content: Owned since May 13'.  Good phone, comes with ability to clear working processes (task manager) and kill active apps which is useful for speed.  Bought otterbox with it.  Still works like new.

Reviews.Title: Great iPhone replacement
Reviews.Author: Keith Nicoll
Reviews.Content: I've had Android in the past, so I knew what I was getting into when going to this phone. I had an iPhone 4S and was just tired of the non-chalant iOS features....it didn't appeal to me anymore since the did the complete redo of their OS. You can't customize and there just seemed to be a boring aspect to the phone. Switching to this is like night and day. Apple sure could learn alot from Android in giving customers what they want - that seems to be a standard iPhone complaint in that people want alot of the features from Android but don't want to give up their Apple product. This phone is fast compared to the 4S but then again that 4S was 2 yrs old also which is a long time (ancient) in the electronics world. I enjoy the bigger screen and the responsiveness of it. There are some quirks I hate, like not being able to easily transition over in regards to text messages, if you had an iPhone previously then you are stuck in iMessage hell if you go to an Android device and most of the suggestions are people within iPhone need to turn off iMessage - that solution sucks cause they won't do that, I guarantee. I had an iPhone and I wouldn't do that. The other quirks I can learn to live with and aren't that big of a deal. Overall this is a great replacement for an iPhone if you are just tired of Apple telling you how you can or can't customize your iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Pretty complex...but good
Reviews.Author: HS
Reviews.Content: Liking this phone...many other reviewers offer terrific detail in their reviews re: capabilities, so no need for me to echo here. Just want to add that I did many hours of research comparing different models and am quite happy with what I chose so far. I'm not a huge tech person, but have had smart phones before, so have some basis for comparison. We're at the 2 month mark, so I'm keeping my fingers crossed.

Reviews.Title: Works so far but the other one we ordered does not.  Verizon will charge you a $30 upgrade fee!
Reviews.Author: C. Whitten
Reviews.Content: I wrote a long review on the other phone "White" phone that broke after less than 12 hours.  On this phone, it seems to work so far.  HOWEVER, YOU WILL BE CHARGED AN UPGRADE FEE OF $30 FOR EACH PHONE THROUGH VERIZON.  They will NOT waiver this even if you have problems.  And you will have to contact Amazon if you have any problems with the phone within the first 30 days, after that you have to deal with Samsung or your carrier.  So far Amazon customer service has been great.

Reviews.Title: Phone is fantastic
Reviews.Author: S L Farrell
Reviews.Content: The good:I choose 4 stars for this device because it's quite amazing.  I came from an old Droid Razr Maxx (not the HD version).  First it doesn't lag and sputter like my Razr Maxx.  The interface is snappy and apps launch quickly.  Given how close it is to CES I predict Samsung will announce the S5 soon but if you have a phone from 2 years ago this is a solid upgrade especially if you can get it for $50 like I did through Amazon.At first I thought I'd hate this phone because the screen's a lot bigger than the Droid Razr Maxx. In reality both phones are nearly the same width across.  They sit in my hand about the same.  The difference is that this phone is taller which can make it hard to hit the buttons but you adjust to it in a couple of days.  I also have small hands so take that into consideration. If you're coming from a iPhone or another 4" screen this is quite a bit bigger.  Despite the size it's not heavy if anything it's lighter than the iPhone 5s.Some of the nice bonuses: IR Remote control and NFC.  I've used the WatchOn app to watch TV and have used it to control Dish, DirectTV, Samsung, Sony, and Roku devices.  It was cool to tap my phone on my printer and watch it print.  Not exactly sure how useful it is but it was neat all the same.The bad:The only reason I won't give the phone 4 stars is due to TouchWiz and Verizon.In 4.3 which the phone currently has Verizon will not allow Google access to one of the chips that allows tap to pay.  When 4.4 Kit Kat is released this shouldn't be a problem as Google is emulating it with software (unless Verizon somehow disables it). In addition, Verizon has taken additional steps to make it more difficult to root this phone (SCH-I545).TouchWiz just looks too cartoonish, Folders expand in ways that take up too much space (Motorola Razr Maxx interface is better).

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Happy patron
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this product; it is as advertised. I would recommend this for anyone looking for an item like this. The purchase was a smooth transaction and delivery.

Reviews.Title: Greatest phone ever!!
Reviews.Author: M. Fairbanks
Reviews.Content: This phone does everything and it does it very well.  Can't wait to see what else I find that it performs.

Reviews.Title: Great phone (once you remove all the Samsung and Verzion bloatware)
Reviews.Author: Michael G.
Reviews.Content: I really love this phone.  The screen is the perfect size for me and running at 1080p it looks great.  The hardware is powerful enough to blow through games and make general phone use (even when heavily multitasking) very snappy.  Battery life isn't anything to write home about, but it's not bad either; I easily get a full day even with heavy use and can get almost 2 days of lighter use.Most of this phone's (few) flaws are software related.  Samsung and Verizon have stocked this phone with unnecessary software from extra media players to third party stores and trial software.  While this isn't anything unexpected with a contract phone on a large carrier, it's still a hassle.  I'm not a TouchWiz hater either, I like a lot of the cool air gesture and eye-tracking features this phone offers by default.  However, I knew before purchasing the phone that I'd be rooting it anyways, so these software woes were rectified without too much effort.I used Kingo Android Root to quickly and easily add root user permissions to the GS4.  Among the most essential apps for removing and taming Samsung/Verizon software are RootAppDelete and Greenify.  The 2 apps alone have made my smartphone experience far more enjoyable.  The only major downside to rooting is that you will get errors when trying to get OS/firmware updates over air (OTA).  Instead, you will have to use a computer program to either manually load a rom or use something like Verzion Upgrade Assistant (what I opt for) to update the phone via USB.Overall I would definitely recommend this phone to anyone looking for a great Android phone, especially if you're going to root.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Phone.
Reviews.Author: Kiel Satterfield
Reviews.Content: This phone is definitely one of the quickest phones I have used. The display is wonderful and the button layout is a solid win. Some of the features are gimmicky at best, but some are a daily driver essential for me. Perfect as a business phone for somone who is contantly on the move. I would highly recommend this phone, especially at the $50 price range.

Reviews.Title: Killer.....
Reviews.Author: Troy J. Gaillard "Deerazz"
Reviews.Content: I have read, reseached and tried to fine a reason not to try this phone BUT no reason was good enough or even came close to giving me a reason. This phone has been nickname the 'iPhone killer' for GOOD reason. Samsung IS what apple was a few years ago da bomb! All the feature(s) of a iphone plus more, more, more. It's a must-have in today's technology driven market....a must-have!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding piece of technology
Reviews.Author: Fawn D Banks
Reviews.Content: I totally love this phone for all its features.  Sure, the iPhone is neat, but I like have and android as a phone and an Apple for my tablet.  It keeps me current on both technologies, and Samsung really has a grasp on the cool side of Androids.  I wouldn't trade my Galaxy S4 for any other phone on the market.  Perfect size, good battery life, tons of available accessories and awesome display.  Who could ask for anything more?

Reviews.Title: really like it
Reviews.Author: Nicola Gibson "nic"
Reviews.Content: never been a big fan of Samsung's overlay, but the removable battery option and expandable memory is priceless. IT's zippy, runs everything and the battery life is so much better than the last generation of phones. Other phones considered: Note 3, HTC One.

Reviews.Title: Galaxy S4
Reviews.Author: MQ3
Reviews.Content: Considering I'm going from a basic flip phone that can text to a smartphone like this one, it's a huge improvement. Call quality is much better with this phone, and the picture quality is good too. There are 5 to 6 settings for pictures. It takes a little getting used to coming from a basic flip phone, but if you're willing to learn, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Holy Bloatware!
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: Great phone, great features, great battery life.  I can only imagine how much better the battery would be if they didn't put so much unnecessary bloated software on it!  I don't want or need most of the constantly running programs and most you can not remove only disable.  I don't need "protection software" from verizon and samsung and google, and three different cloud connections and 3 different mapping programs etc. etc....

Reviews.Title: Definitely 5 stars!  Great phone!  Easy set up!  Easy transaction!
Reviews.Author: Jnet
Reviews.Content: OMG I am so happy with this phone!  First of all:  a Samsung S 4 for a penny!  Best Buy can't even match that and neither can Verizon.  I checked!  The ordering process was flawless.  I selected my phone and just followed the prompts to set up a new account with Verizon.  The phone was at my house in two days (included in the price)!  The phone itself is a really nice greyish black.  The back cover is easy to remove however, it does seem very flimsy in comparison to my last phone.  If you drop this it definitely will do some damage.  Having said that, I usually buy a case/cover to protect my phone anyway and everyone I know that has not had a case/cover has ended up breaking their screen when they dropped their phone.  Why wouldn't you invest in a case?  You can get them here or on ebay for $5 and up.  Setting up the phone:  SIM card, easy;  Memory card, easy.  Ported my old number from the carrier I used to have (the instructions come in the email) but Verizon actually called me!  The service is very good so far, internet speeds are good and there's nothing hard about customizing the phone if you can read and follow instructions.  The only thing that does bug me is a notification that keeps popping up (I think its from Samsung) in regard to security.  It comes in the shape of a shield and appears on the notification bar.  I noticed there is an actual app called KNOX which I have not researched yet, so I haven't downloaded it so I'm guessing it's something to do with that.  I have not been able to get rid of it on a permanent basis and if you click on it to update, it doesn't.  That's my only gripe so if anyone knows how to fix that, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: Entering a new era
Reviews.Author: Monica Smith "Wild Wacky Woman"
Reviews.Content: I am 70+ and it is my first smartphone.  It has taken me about 6 weeks to use and feel comfortable using most of the functions though I need to remind myself to go to settings!  A great bargain with prompt efficient service.

Reviews.Title: Best Smart Phone on the market hands on!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The best phone on the market today!  I started out with the Galaxy Fascinate, then moved up to the S3, and now the S4.  I have to say I'm very pleased with this phone in every way.  This blows away the iPhone by miles, which my wife and son both had until recently.  They were so glad to move over to Android and Samsung phones!  You will be too.  There are endless apps for about anything you can think of, the phone is easy to navigate, the screen is gorgeous and a nice size, the feel of it in your had is perfect, it's fast and has great speaker! This one will make anyone happy!  Get it.

Reviews.Title: Dead after 3 hours
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It's very difficult to rate this phone accurately since I only had mine for 3 hours. I need to review it as a warning to others though. I ordered this phone through amazons Black Friday deals. Great price. I received it and charged it fully. Activated it and started using it. Screen is beautiful. No lags. Easy to operate. Really had no complaints. LOVED it. Then while using it, with still 1/2 battery charge left, it DIED. Would not power back on. Would not charge. Took it to a Verizon store and they tried a new battery and a power pack and verified that it was, indeed, dead. I had to return the phone to Amazon. Fortunately, Verizon was able to reactivate my old phone. I got my refund from Amazon very quickly but I'm still waiting for the contract to be cancelled so I can order a new phone (I'm not going to go through Amazon this time). I'm not sure if there is a problem with this phone, Amazon's phone program, or if I just happened to get a dud. I will probably try this phone again, but I'm going through Verizon this time so I can get help locally if something goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: awesome phone
Reviews.Author: theladybug
Reviews.Content: I apprehensively went from an iPhone 4.  I have no idea why I was so scared to switch to a droid.  The interface is easy to use and figure out.  There are a lot of helpful tutorials online too.Only problem so far is after the last update with the software, there was a security update and it says my wifi is unsecured and gives me a warning everytime I am in wifi range.  It is mildly annoying, but nothing major.

Reviews.Title: Very nice phone
Reviews.Author: dwf "computer guy"
Reviews.Content: It is a great phone.  I've had it for a number of months now and it has worked very well.  I've addedan extended battery for better battery life, because I use the phone quite heavily for browsingand navigation.  I have rooted the phone which so far has prevented me from doing any of the upgradesthat have been sent out.  The screen is a very nice size

Reviews.Title: Excellent Smart Phone!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Amazon Crazy"
Reviews.Content: My entire family has an iPhone so I decided to be different, and I am glad I was. So I got Apple’s #1 nemesis, the Samsung Galaxy S4. I was a little paranoid because of the large size but when I got a look at the amazing resolution of this 5” screen I was sold.  The super sharp picture and fast refresh rate makes watching a movie on the S4 a very enjoyable experience. And the photos I take with my S4 are so crisp and clear with color unlike any camera I have seen on a smart phone.  I got the 32gb version then added a 32gb SD card giving me more then enough memory to store plenty of apps, photos, and video. There are so many pros with the S4 I can't even list them all. The only con I can think of is the rather flimsy back cover that would not take much to break. But the new OtterBox case I purchased pretty much took care of that. Otherwise the Samsung Galaxy S4  is in my opinion the best choice among all top smart phones.

Reviews.Title: My first Samsung phone will likely not be my last
Reviews.Author: MichaelB
Reviews.Content: Major league upgrade from my Droid Bionic: Faster, lighter, and more battery life as well as a quality screen. It is a bit overkill on features... but that beats the inverse soundly.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Phone
Reviews.Author: J. Minatel "jimmin"
Reviews.Content: Here's a short list of what I love about this phone:Incredible big bright screen with great resolution but the phone itself is not overly big and still has a nice feel in the hand or pocketGreat battery life in real life - well over a full day even under heavy useThe camera both for still photos and video is all it's cracked up to beBest thing - I've now had it 2 months and didn't have to reboot or restart it once until yesterday which was for a system upgrade. It's been rock-solid stable with no crashes or freezesThis is also my first time using Verizon in probably 10 years after a long time with AT&T; and tMobile. I've been thrilled with Verizon call quality on this phone compared to AT&T; on the previous iphones and Atrix I had most recently.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Timothy B Hashinger
Reviews.Content: I have had many android phones and just got rid of the Apple I Phone 5 never will  have another Iphone , the S-4 is an unbelivable phone , so many features on this phone i could spend an hour writing the things this phone does , but i am not going to , its just an incredible phone thats all i can say

Reviews.Title: Better than IPhone
Reviews.Author: Daria Porter
Reviews.Content: Great Phone! Love it! A little more difficult than an IPhone. And a few too many apps you can't get rid of. But way more fun!

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: vcruser
Reviews.Content: very good battery life its a great phone worth every penny I highly recommend this phone i like it better than my bionic

Reviews.Title: Love this phone
Reviews.Author: Teresa L Rebert
Reviews.Content: I love this phone.  I haven't found a thing that I dislike. Still discovering all the new features. Best phone I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: Best Phone Ever
Reviews.Author: John G. Seitz
Reviews.Content: I have owned them all. This phone is a game changer. Sleek, top-of-the-line tech, good battery life. The only thing missing is perhaps a little more robust shell. This phone is Awesome!

Reviews.Title: Happy wife, happy life
Reviews.Author: Don Fredricks
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my beloved, as an upgrade to her aging Galaxy S "Fascinate", which seemed to be getting slower and slower as time went on. And because it's old, there aren't any more software updates to be had either from Verizon or from Samsung.We had considered upgrading for (relatively) cheap using Verizon's "new every two" policy, but that would have meant a new contract -- and she's still on the old unlimited contract, which isn't being offered any longer. I did the math, and the current offerings work out to be significantly more costly for my family. Not wanting to rock that particular boat, I opted to pay full price (ouch!) for a no-contract Verizon-branded Galaxy S4.Still, I wasn't absolutely sure it was going to work. Would Verizon actually give us the needed SIM card? Would they actually let us switch the equipment on the line without changing the contract? Would the S4 really perform significantly better than the old Fascinate?Happily, the answer to all of these questions was YES. We went to our local Verizon store last evening, where a nice young man named Chris was happy to help us (yes, he actually did seem happy). He was surprised that the phone didn't come with a SIM, but had no trouble finding one to install. He started up and activated the phone for us, and demonstrated some of its cool features. "Keep that unlimited deal as long as you can!" he said. The total cost for the SIM card, and activating the phone, was ZERO.At least a few times, my wife has been heard to exclaim, "Wow! This thing is so much faster than the old one!" :)Now, to get rid of all the Verizon bloatware....

Reviews.Title: Amazing Phone
Reviews.Author: K. Wallace "- Kindle Fire HD"
Reviews.Content: This truly an amazing phone. Been using this phone for almost two months now and was sold the first day I got it!It's sleek, fast, and over performs. Being able to control your televisions comes in handy way more than you would think. And also gives plenty of opportunity to mess with people.The camera is amazing, pictures come out Crystal clear, and the camera options provide plenty of picture settings.The ONLY problem with this phone is the speakers. While it is loud, sometimes it just isn't loud enough. But other than the one problem with the speakers, this phone deserves a 12/10

Reviews.Title: First smartphone users should get this
Reviews.Author: Cho
Reviews.Content: I chose this for aunt who wanted her first smartphone. Her eyes are still great ,but this screen is so large it is ease on the eyes and really great for older people who wants to try their first smartphone. Unlike iphone or other smartphone she can easily type text message with this. Also, the program is pretty nice, it is beautiful , I have a iphone and I am waiting for ios 7 to come out ,but really the screen is amazing. However, I didn't like the way the back cover closes, it is very thin plastic, and I was afraid it will break when I tried to open it.
