Reviews.Title: Its good
Reviews.Author: wertwert2000
Reviews.Content: I like the product a lot. If the battery life was increased maybe 20 %, the phone would be much better.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: fishingforstuff
Reviews.Content: LOVE it just not the battery. Wonderful features, just cant use it a tone all day or the battery will die around 5 or 6

Reviews.Title: Awesome Phone
Reviews.Author: Dean P
Reviews.Content: The Samsung galaxy S4 is an excellent phone. Best smart phone I have ever owed. Great features, fast, you can be on the phone and use apps and Internet at the same time. This phone rocks and puts iPhone to shame. Hands down better. You will not have any regrets buying this phone. Even pictures and videos it takes are really good. Best phone ever!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!
Reviews.Author: Matthew S. Parker
Reviews.Content: Liked the S2 and this blows it away. I am happy now that I dumped Sprint and moved to Verizon. I actually have service. Stay away from Sprint, especially in South Florida.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied and Enjoying my purchase
Reviews.Author: I2C
Reviews.Content: Took much time to import my apps from google play and Amazon, but this is expected with any phone.Afterward, I enjoy:- the big 5 inch screen- screen resolution is awesome- long battery life- camera quality (although haven't found out how to disable the picture snapping sound.  Ugh!)- performance- supplied apps (the calendar is great and comparable to my previous purchased app)- etc.My unexpected learning curve of where Samsung or maybe its Jelly Bean / Android OS places settings and menu items took some time.  I also miss some of my HTC notification tones of my last phone, but I'm a techie and was able to recreate my own mp3s ;-)Still trying to find out how to disable the soft button press vibrating, but not a high priority and just a personal preference of mine.Overall: Enjoying my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice 5-inch mobility
Reviews.Author: M. Mcclure
Reviews.Content: I bought the Samsung Galaxy S4 when I was eligible to upgrade on my AT&T; plan [May 2013]. I replaced a Motorola Atrix that I used for two years [April 2011].I went into the AT&T; store intending to buy an Apple iPhone 5; my wife got an iPhone in December and I liked it. The salesperson suggested that I consider some of the other newly available devices. After looking over the Samsung Galaxy S4, I decided to get it instead of the iPhone.  It was not an easy decision because the Galaxy is larger than the iPhone, and both are larger than my old Atrix. I really liked the convenience of the Atrix. I never used a case on the Atrix; just a screen protector. The Atrix easily fit in back pocket of jeans and was always easy to grab an use. The larger size of the Galaxy makes it bit more awkward to grasp and pull from a pocket, so I put it in an Otterbox case, which makes it even larger, but easier to grab and hold securely. I really like the larger screen.All "Android" systems are not the same. The Atrix is an Android. I really like Android Swype text entry. In some ways Swype has been improved on the Galaxy, and at the same time the new Swype is missing some things that I liked on the Atrix.There are trade-offs in picking a mobile device. Screen-size versus portability is the most difficult choice. The bigger screen [5-inch diagonal] is easier to read and touch-navigate when using the phone, but it means the device must be a little bit larger. A 4-inch screen makes a device more compact, but one needs to do more zooming/scrolling when using the device.One definite plus is battery life and device weight. The Galaxy is noticeably lighter weight than my old Atrix, and the Galaxy battery life is noticeably longer/better than my old Atrix. Even though the Galaxy has a larger screen and newer/faster processors the battery lasts longer.The camera on the Galaxy is very nice. The first day I had it I went for a walk in the woods. I saw a pine seedling growing out of a stump. I had the camera very close to the tiny seedling, just a few inches. I touched the screen on the seedling image and the focus snapped in crystal clear, then I touched the shutter button to take the photo. I did not want to zoom because I had learned on the Atrix that zoom was digital (i.e. fewer/larger pixels) and not optical. The result on the Galaxy was similar to using a macro-lens on my old Olympus SLR film camera. The resulting photo has incredible detail even though the camera was only inches from the subject. I essentially made a life-size photo of the tiny seedling in the 5-inch diagonal screen.One reason that I thought I wanted the iPhone was for Facetime. My wife and children have iPhones and Facetime is simple and automatic on Apple devices. I had expected to be able to use Skype on the Atrix when I bought it... but this did not materialize in the first few months of Atrix ownership and I gave up looking, downloading, experimenting. The AT&T; rep said there are many video-call software options that enable Apple and non-Apple devices to have video calls. I haven't had a strong enough urge to video call to go to the trouble of downloading the app; so I guess for me video call is more of a clever idea than something I really want to do or need to do. I like the usability of the larger screen on the Galaxy S4 compared to the iPhone 5 for browsing the Internet, reading/writing messages and email.My review is rambling a little; not the crisp technical review some authors write.Overall, I am satisfied with the Samsung Galaxy S4. It works; battery life is improved compared to devices from 2-years ago; 5-inch screen is more usable than smaller screen; camera seems to be improved over devices from 2-years ago.

Reviews.Title: Worked Fine Until It Suddenly Died
Reviews.Author: Northern Traveler
Reviews.Content: This phone replaced my 3 year old iPhone 4.  It was a decent replacement but it had several bugs (camera failures, frozen apps) that gave me cause for concern.  After only 4 months of use it suddenly stopped working for no obvious reason (the battery was at 91%, it wasn't dropped, damaged or used on unsafe websites or apps).  I was using the browser (Google News page) when the screen went black.  That was 3 days ago and the phone hasn't responded to any attempt to bring it back to life.  Unfortunately I can't return it through Amazon, so I'm back to using my 3 year old iPhone 4.  Should have stayed with Apple.

Reviews.Title: Unusable outside
Reviews.Author: Charles Hallback
Reviews.Content: Read tons of reviews, what most don't say is how unusable this is outside, it's barely viewable in the shade and not at all usable in direct sunlight. Compared it to my 3 year old ipod touch 4, and the ipod is far more usable outside.A couple of irritants: Used as a music player, keep getting this irritating popup warning when trying to turn the volume up about it being dangerous, with no way to turn warning off permanently. Makes for a bad experience when your trying to walk,run, bike, etc, and you have to pull the phone out of your pocket to see why the volume won't go up, and of course if you're outside, you can't see the screen. Come on Samsung, not all headphones have the same efficiencies. People have been bith*n about this for years.Like most phones and iPods, the equalizer app only works with the built in music player, not with any third party music apps.Caching with Slacker radio plus doesn't seem to work right on this phone, it keeps stopping.Camera takes great pictures, but you can't see the screen to click on the icon to take a picture/video outside.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from Galaxy Nexus to this. OMG it's full of stars
Reviews.Author: Talbot Shoemaker
Reviews.Content: My previous girlfriend was the Samsung galaxy nexus LTE Verizon. Just like how I met the galaxy nexus, I met the galaxy s4 online after missing a link on an Android OS fan website. I glanced at her with the tainted glaze of a man in love, but looked again at her alluring curves and quad core processor.After a few moments my galaxy nexus was wondering what I was doing, gazing longingly at another smartphone, and I closed my browser as fast as I could. Weeks later, when the galaxy nexus was recharging in the bedroom, I was able to have a free moment at the computer. I browsed in chrome to find information on this new alluring Galaxy S4 and I was perfectly surprised.LTE, super fast wireless internet1080p screen which shines with the power of the sun, and in just as good resolution for my perfect vision.She just seemed to tease me with her expandable memory, and inclusion of S voice.But just like a girl on prom night, she was the Belle of the ball, in her fancy dress with touchwiz features. Sure it looked so pretty from far away. So, glimmering, white, shiny, etc. And it drew me in with all the handy wavy features that I could wave my hand at.I went to bed that night with dreams of a better tomorrow in my future... maybe.So, when I got up the next day, and the galaxy nexus was pissed. See with this Google environment, if you browse in chrome on your computer with your Google account that you have synced to android, then that android device will know that you were looking up information on another phone. She was judging me for days, and calling me mean names about longing for a new phone that wasn't even born yet.A few weeks later, after I hadn't thought about the S4 in months, and my relationship with my galaxy nexus was going fine, there was the release date announcement. This time I couldn't contain my excitement and the galaxy nexus could tell. But this time, she was a bit more understanding. Anything that I'm passionate for, she should encourage, so long as it's healthy behavior.I should have said on the outset that Galaxy nexus and I are in an open relationship, and include other phones as guests from time to time. But this was different.Fast forward to my decision to purchase my new girlfriend, and everyone was so excited. The galaxy nexus and the s4 got along with sharing so much information about me and each other using DLNA, and NFC. And the speed of that S4, was just amazing.There's the usual, "familiarity" period with introducing someone new to the family like this, so I thought I'd just make a light transition, spending more and more time with the S4 everyday. Ignoring some, specific flaws in my "love has blinders on," "honeymoon," phase of our relationship.After a time, it was hard to ignore certain things that came up.The bloatware that can't be removed takes up space of my darling's poor 16GB of storage, leaving only about 6 GB of usable space.The smartwatch touchwiz feature is annoying after you realize how often you look away from your phone while watching a video.And the handy wavy gestures thing, is just like... getting up to that beautiful dress at prom/ball/whatever, and finding that it was indeed stitched together by some backwoods seamstress making minimum wage and clearly missed the point of some features of the dress.But, I've come to terms with her flaws. She loves me, and I love her. We're both willing to risk surgery via custom ROM to fix some more of her glaring flaws. But maybe that's down the road. We're both fine right now.

Reviews.Title: First smartphone, may be biased,  but it's keen
Reviews.Author: jmnvhc
Reviews.Content: I love the S4.  It worried me a little bit when I opened it how large it was,  but once I started using it and realized it fits in my front pocket and I don't notice it really,  I gelled with it quickly.The large screen is pretty key to the experience.  I can watch shows in my bed at night comfortably,  surf the web and read comfortably.  I actually prefer to surf on it over my laptop because of the compactness and instant-on.My wife has a iPhone 5 and whenever I tinker around with it I can't imagine how anyone can do anything useful on such a tiny screen.  I'd never surf the web for more than a minute or so on the iPhone.  The S4 is almost a cross-over between a smartphone and an iPad mini.It's comfortable to use as a phone as well,  I think.Very smooth OS,  fast processor,  really happy.

Reviews.Title: Better than iPhone by far!!
Reviews.Author: Kyle Harris
Reviews.Content: Best phone out!! I'm sure the S5 may be a little better. But this phone is 10 times better than any iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S4
Reviews.Author: BRAD SALTZMAN
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone in all respects, except for battery life. Very impressed. Call quality is excellent, screen is great & speed is great.

Reviews.Title: Love The Phone, Hate Verizon
Reviews.Author: Byrin
Reviews.Content: This phone is wonderful. The screen looks crisp and clear, battery lasts forever, everything is fluid smooth with all that processing power under the hood. Samsung continues its legacy of wonderful but expensive cell phones.

Reviews.Title: hindered by crappy touchwiz software
Reviews.Author: Wayne
Reviews.Content: I've been a Samsung Android user since the S2.  Over the years I've blamed much of the sluggishness, apps freezing, apps closing, etc to the design and coding of android.  I loved the S4 at first but once I started loading it with apps I noticed once again apps having issues and general sluggishness of the phone.  My observation leaned on widgets on the home screen running in the ui thread as being the culprit.  After talking to other android owners and researching on the net Touchwiz was pinpointed as the culprit of my woes.  Touchwiz is merely poorly written software that happens to be intercepting all the UI events and causing it to stall.  In some cases causes apps to freeze and crash.After my final months of frustration I began my search for an android replacement (I'd prefer IOS but I need a screen in the 5 inch range).  I narrowed down my search to the HTC One and LG G2.  I've been using the LG G2 for a few months now and besides having a faster processor there's little in their UI overlay software that gets in the way of android.  I've yet to experience app freezes and crashes.  On the galaxy s4 I'd even have problems with google maps freezing on me.  And let me tell you, the user experience on the G2 when it comes to performance is the way Android was meant to be experienced.It wasn't easy to come clean and admit that Samsung faltered on their execution as my friends would consider me a Samsung fanboy of sorts.  I love their tvs, refrigerators, washers and dryers... but the TouchWiz programming, QA, design teams need to actually start using their product along with their competition.  If it's slow.. makes things crash... then it sucks.As an aside, I went so far as to put the Galaxy S4 in developer mode and turned off the TouchWiz UI transition effects and that only provided a minor relief.  I hope that Samsung addresses the Touchwiz issues as I'd love to get back on the bandwagon, but that won't happen until they realize there even is a problem.... starting with these reviews.

Reviews.Title: So far - so good
Reviews.Author: Bruce Laidlaw

Reviews.Author: James Becker

Reviews.Title: Exactly as tech reviews describe it.
Reviews.Author: Michael Alexander
Reviews.Content: It's the S4.  There are plenty of tech reviewers out there who have done full work-ups on all the different features, so I'll just hit the main points I noticed.Battery Life:The battery life is surprisingly good.  I've had a number of these types of phones before, ones that are "cutting edge", and most of them have terrible battery life.  I've had my S4 for almost a year now and the battery life is still very good.  I do charge it nightly, but if I forget I can usually make it almost 2 full days on the charge.  This of course assumes I'm not playing any full-screen games, keeping the screen on for any length of time, or checking Facebook (all of which significantly drain every phone's battery).  One point on this though is that I've got most of the special Samsung features like S-Voice, Air View, Smart Pause, Smart Scroll, NFC, S-Beam, Multi-Window, and Smart Stay turned off.  I do however keep Air Gestures on.  I also have Bluetooth off most of the time, only turning it on when I need it, and I use the Tasker app to automatically disable my WiFi when I'm not near known connections like my house, my friends' houses, etc.  If you keep Bluetooth on all the time, or WiFi on for the "location support" provided by Google, you're looking at about a 25% reduction in how long the battery will last.Samsung apps and features:As pretty much everyone that's rated Samsung devices in the last 3 years has said, just turn them off unless you're showing them off to a friend.  The "eye detection" that's used for the Smart Pause, Smart Scroll, and Smart Stay not only eats battery like crazy while constantly trying to locate your face and eyes, but is delayed and spotty under normal usage conditions.  The Air View and Multi-Window only work with a few apps, most of which are ones I never use to begin with, so it's not worth the battery cost and responsiveness costs of having them enabled (especially the Air View that eats even more power trying to detect your finger before it even touches the screen).  The Air Gesture is actually pretty good, depending on which ones you've turned on, but anything that involves scrolling or pausing basically doesn't work, get an app like WaveControl for that instead.  All the scrolling and pausing stuff, when it even works, only works with a few apps, once again mostly apps I never use.  The S-Voice is still notoriously bad, unable to detect almost anything correctly and having an extremely limited set of commands that can be used.  The automatic wake-up feature of it also drains battery so fast you'll be plugging the phone in for a full recharge twice a day even if you don't otherwise use it.  The contacts app was a huge step forward from Samsung's last one, actually allowing contact integration from sources like Facebook, Twitter, etc, and joining and splitting of contacts in a reasonable manner.  It still seems to have a few problems with selecting the default source for a joined contact getting overwritten by the latest data source to update (so you'll almost always see the latest Facebook picture of your contacts rather than ones from Google+ if Facebook syncs more frequently like mine does), but that's minor and can be fixed by saving the picture locally and selecting the local contact as your default.  The calendar app is also a huge step forward, integrating all your calendar sources well and providing a nice mechanism for setting all the important fields from multiple calendar sources. Somehow despite a lot of the stock app updates they provide that have better integration for the features of Android, they still have what I believe to be one of the worst launchers of anyone (the home screen settings, display, etc).  The first thing you should do is go get the free Nova Launcher, Go Launcher EX, or ADW Launcher (or any other for that matter), install it, and set it as your default.  Every launcher out there is better in almost every way from the stock one and has been since well before the S4 even came out.Size and construction:The S4 was originally touted as having a "very large screen", albeit smaller than the Notes do, and they weren't kidding.  The screen is nice and large, with a very good resolution display.  It's not as good as a retina display, nothing else is that sharp, but it is significantly larger.  The phone itself feels solid, and the metal bevel around the outside edge gives it that quality feel previous models didn't have.  The battery cover is very thin plastic, so thin I worried about tearing it when putting in the battery and SIM card the first time, but it holds up really well and is much more sturdy than it initially feels.  The screen is virtually unscratchable, and doesn't crack even with rough use.  I accidentally dropped my phone down an entire flight of concrete stairs a few months ago, without any case on it whatsoever, and all I got was a single crack along one corner that doesn't impede the screen at all and can't be felt when running fingers over it.  After almost a year of use, the only noticeable wear effects were on where the "metal" bevel edges come up to the edge of the face.  The "metal" parts are starting to wear off (I keep my phone in my pocket without a case so it's sliding in and out of my jeans regularly) and reveal the sturdy white plastic they're actually constructed of.Overall I would highly suggest this phone for anyone looking for a new one, even over the Note 3 that's supposedly a newer and larger screened model (mostly because of the battery life).

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Seth
Reviews.Content: Yes it could do everything as advertised but with a delay in performance. I own iPhones and familiar with responsiveness. This device is not that responsive when several features are enabled. Returned and refunded.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: William J Myers
Reviews.Content: The Samsung S4 is an innovative phone that seems to have endless capabilities. Everyday i pick the phone up i learn something new about it. Very pleased and highly recommend the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Best Phone yet
Reviews.Author: trvlnb3
Reviews.Content: One word sums it up, FAST! I've had the phone now for 2 months and what a difference in the technology from just 2 years ago. Don't care for most of the bloatware, but Samsung has a couple of great standard apps. One of the most impressive improvements, is the ability to turn off unwanted apps through the application manager. Yes, TURN OFF, not just "Force Stop". This means faster startup times, and very little lag between apps. Screen is vivid and clear. Camera is amazing, picture clarity and editing is the best I've seen on any phone I've had to date. Disclosure! I am a true believer in Samsung, most of my electronics are Samsung, but I left the Samsung phone line after a disappointing unit called the Instinct. Samsung has redeemed their phone line.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic phone, minus the bloatware
Reviews.Author: Spence
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Galaxy S4 is the fastest, prettiest, most impressive cellular device I've ever seen. Every feature of it is stunning, the screen, the speed, the camera, If it was running a better version of Android, it would be perfect.But there's the problem. It runs TouchWiz, Samsung's version of Android that comes with a bunch of useless Samsung apps you don't need or want and cannot delete. Oh, and since it's a Verizon phone, it comes with a bunch of useless Verizon apps you don't need or want and cannot delete. Oh, and since I ordered it from Amazon, it comes with a bunch of Amazon apps.... see where this is going? Basically this is an amazing phone that is let down by its operating system.Now if you are brave enough to do it, installing a custom rom that's closer to vanilla Android, or at least removes some of those useless apps is really the solution.As is, it's still one of the best phones you can buy.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal phone, but with intrinsic problems
Reviews.Author: Reister
Reviews.Content: This is by far a top of the line phone.  It's big, it's fast, it's powerful.  However, I would NOT recommend it for the following reasons:  1. Samsung and Verizon have crammed so much useless technology into it that only 53% of the RAM is usable.  This junkware is non-removable. (-1/2 Star)  2. It's too big.  I didn't want such a big phone, but to get the features and power that I wanted, this was the only option. (-1/2 Star)  3. Because of it's size, the glass has to be super-tensioned, which makes it prone to cracking under the slightest of adverse conditions.  I pulled mine out of my pocket one day and the glass had cracked and the LCD digitizer was non-functional. I did not drop it or sit on it.  No mistreatment, just cracks.  It's estimated that 1 out of 8 Galaxy S3 and S4 phones will crack.  (-1 Star)  4. Samsung did not honor the manufacturer warranty on defective materials and sent it back to me with more cracks than it had when I sent it to them. (-1 Star)  The cost to fix the glass and digitizer ranges from $250 to $325.  Samsung wanted $200, but I refuse to give them more money to fix a problem that they caused.  I'll support a local merchant.

Reviews.Title: Massive Amounts of Gross Bloatware
Reviews.Author: Tawn
Reviews.Content: This is fast, has a bright screen, vivid colors, good camera, but is filled with resource taking bloatware. Unwanted applications like NFL Mobile have been built-in. You can't uninstall them without rooting your phone, and they take up RAM and some of them run constantly soaking up battery juice. You will have trouble finding your apps in the drawer because it's filled with the bloatware icons.You can disable these parasitic programs, but naturally there is no "Disable" button. No, that would be convenient for the customer, and it's all about Samsung.1. Go into Settings, More (swipe all the way to the left), Applications Manager, All.2. Chose an offending application, like S Health.3. Uncheck the "Show Notifications" box first, then click on "Force Stop". You will get a dire warning telling you this could be BAD for your phone. Ooooh, scary! Then click on the "Turn Off/On" button to turn it off. You will get another warning.Sometimes you will get a message saying the program is being replaced by "a factory version" and gives you a choice of either "Cancel" or "Ok", not "NO, I DON'T ANY VERSION OF THIS ON MY PHONE!!" Choose "Ok" and the program should be stopped.4. There is a list of "Turned Off" apps in the Application Manager at the very end (swipe screen to the left) to see if you were successful in disabling the junk.Don't ever try to stop or turn off any program with the little green Android man icon next to it!!Another way to get rid of phone bloatware is to get a task killer app. I use Advanced Task Killer.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Smith
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever smartphone, so I don't have much to compare it to, but I absolutely LOVE this phone. It's fast. Like super fast. I've had it a week and have not had any sort of lag issues whatsoever. I like all the little features and ways you can customize it. There is a lot of bloatware that I'd eventually like to remove by rooting my device, but not just yet.The battery life is OK, but the thing charges really fast. I can go from 30% to 100% in about an hour or less. The battery typically lasts me about a day with medium use.The camera takes GREAT pictures and great video. Makes it nice to not have to drag my camera around with me if I'm somewhere where I might want to take a picture.WalMart has this phone for a great price with a new 2-year contract. $138 plus they give you a $40 WalMart gift card which I used to purchase an Otterbox case.

Reviews.Title: Has a flaw but good overall
Reviews.Author: Tyler S
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone about a month ago and am impressed  of the speed and great battery life. But I have had many problems using the phone with the touch screen. I have big hands and tend to touch the screen when trying to hit the home button, or the back button gets pressed. The back button is very sensitive. They made the border WAY too small on the bottom of the phone. It gets to be very annoying as it happens at least once a day. Other than this issue it's a great phone.

Reviews.Title: Battery drains very quickly
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "duluth boy"
Reviews.Content: I understand why Costco gave me a "free" car charger when I bought this.  This phone drains the battery very quickly.  After a full charge before going to bed, it's down to only 40 to 50% of the charge left when you get up in the morning.  I have not been able to go more than five hours before having to charge it.  Also, I asked if Verizon would have decent coverage throughout Northern Michigan.  Again, very limited, which is frustrating since I have to be in that area during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: Great phone...when it works...
Reviews.Author: BookHunter
Reviews.Content: My first Galaxy S4 refused to turn on or charge after a couple weeks, so Amazon sent me a new one. My second Galaxy S4 worked great for 2 months and now it's having issues as well. The screen randomly goes black and then the phone reboots when I try to turn it on again. I have tried restoring it to factory default settings and the issue persists.Of course, now I'm 2 weeks outside of the return policy so I have to deal with Samsung's warranty. We'll see how that goes, but right now I wish I had purchased a different phone.For the record, I baby this phone. I have not dropped it, gotten it wet, etc. I usually don't have problems with any technology products I purchase, but I am definitely having issues with this device, which is unfortunate because it's a great product when it works.

Reviews.Title: Careful!
Reviews.Author: Vincent Lewandowski
Reviews.Content: I love the phone, but I just dropped it yesterday from my hand to the garage floor. I even had a Goospery Flexible TPU Jelly Case on it, but the screen cracked anyway, totally disabling the screen.

Reviews.Title: Much faster but basically an s3
Reviews.Author: fabphil
Reviews.Content: Ok so I had an s3 and decided to go for the s4. Notable differences is screen is a little bigger, and I can tell a speed difference. Charger plugin still on the bottom, and sleep key and volume keys still across from each other, so its hard to push one and not the other when holding in one hand. Now for the meat of this review. I thought the s3 was the best phone I have ever owned, and aside from a couple small differences it still is. I am happy with the s4 so far, but the s3 is still a great phone for the money. If you do not have to have the latest and greatest go with the s3. Its a great phone for very little money. All in all I am pleased with samsungs phones as of late. For me the s4 is perfect, for a general user wanting something spectacular for $20 go with the s3, Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: I love this phone
Reviews.Author: Michael D Patterson
Reviews.Content: This phone is fast and has a beautiful 5" screen . Coming from a Droid 2 it took about 3 hours to configure and customize the screens to my preferences. The camera is the best I have used on any phone (the rest of my family all use I phones 4S and 5).  This camera coupled with removeable storage and removeable batteries will be very useful on vacations and for home video of my grandchildren. The  movie I streamed looked sharp and clear on the 1080  5" HD screen.  HD quality home video takes my home videos to a new level and means now I can just take my phone and not a movie camera also to events. I love this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Jmay
Reviews.Content: Coming from an iPhone this has been a learning experience but a good one for sure. Although I have only had it for a few days it is a nice change of pace. Being able to customize the OS a lot more than on iOS makes it fun and unique. The phone also speeds through apps and the Play Store with ease. The 16gb limit wasn't a huge deal for me because you can store all your movies, music. pics on the micro sd card, you cannot store apps on the micro sd card though so be aware of that. I will admit that some of the hand gestures are not the easiest to learn and are very situational and not very useful every day. Overall a great phone so far.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone
Reviews.Author: Kathrin Wamego
Reviews.Content: Love the phone better than any other phone I've had easy to use and everything on it is perfect so I would tell anyone to buy it

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: From Detroit
Reviews.Content: I had to upgrade from a Galaxy Nexus.  Since Verizon doesn't carry a Nexus 5, I had to find something else.  Over all, I like Samsung's products, and this phone did not disappoint.  It's fast, with a fantastic display.  The battery life with the standard battery is wonderful (I could get 2 days on one charge with light-to-moderate use.  Less if I have to rely on the 4G connection a lot, or if I watch a lot of video.)  Call quality is great, and it seems to receive signal better than my Galaxy Nexus.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good but not the best out there
Reviews.Author: Thomas Cox
Reviews.Content: I had the HTC one but got it wet and fried the device.  Sad day for me but went with my next choice. Highly satisfied with the s4 but not as fast or loud as the one. Still a premium smart phone

Reviews.Title: Good for the 7 months so far
Reviews.Author: Aliepora22
Reviews.Content: seven months down the road and so far so good. the only drawback I've noticed is it does not have a button for photos on the edge of the phone, so you have to hold the phone and press the camera button on the screen. Fine for taking normal shots, but cumbersome for selfies or close-ups with others.

Reviews.Title: samsung galaxy s 4 min
Reviews.Author: shelton wiggins
Reviews.Content: My son love this phone it is a great improvement over the Droid X it is a great phone he loves it

Reviews.Title: Great So Far
Reviews.Author: Lafayette D. Bell
Reviews.Content: So far so good. Haven't experienced any of the fears that I had about the phone. One months use and I'm still getting familiarized.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful and speedy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Overall great phone! Love the beautiful display and camera, plus very speedy. I wish the sound was a little better, but I can use an external speaker if I want.

Reviews.Title: Family Affair
Reviews.Author: Kelly R. Van Nevel "krvn12"
Reviews.Content: Amazing phone...whole family has one on our 5 person family plan.  Easy to use...great price & just the right size.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer

Reviews.Title: Excellent phone at an unbelievable price
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Fraser
Reviews.Content: I was due for an upgrade from Verizon.  I researched the Galaxy S5 and compared against the S4.  I went with the S4 after my research could not find any noticeable difference between them (except the price).  Verizon wanted $99 for the S4, and Amazon had it for $50.  The camera on the S4 is remarkable when compared to my old Samsung Charge.  The call quality is much better, and the screen larger.  I wish I had upgraded earlier.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone period.
Reviews.Author: Blake Formon
Reviews.Content: This phone is superior, it's fast, has 2 gigs of ram, the touch is seamless, runs all modern applications, and the display is beautiful. The battery life is such that unless I'm playing a game for a couple hours it last for over a day and 1/2 (not in power save mode) I also use it as a reader.The only real CON with this phone is the CON with every android phone and that is.... THE BLOATWARE. Some of it's a real pain in the ass to remove to, many of the stock Samsung apps are useful but don't put stuff on my phone without my consent so you can market to me and advertise to me. These apps eat up my RAM and run without my/your knowledge most of the time. Other than that you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: What can I Say...Best Phone EVER!
Reviews.Author: Laura Libby "Proud Air Force Wife"
Reviews.Content: I love this phone so much I will not even consider another brand. Easy to use, quick, responsive. Everything you ever wanted in a Smartphone.

Reviews.Title: working great no problems
Reviews.Author: Robert Watson
Reviews.Content: Phone, camera, MP3 player, GPS directions, calendar with reminders, email alerts, NFL red zone, multiple weather zone, voice texting, it goes on and on and on. It just blows me away what this phone can do and even more impressive was how easy it was to learn how to use it. The operating system has a fairly short learning curve and is rather intuitive. I was a long to hold out when it came to smart phones, I did not want to pay the extra $30 p/mo. but I have to admit it I was wrong it is well worth it.

Reviews.Content: Brand new Phone ---less then 3weeks old--and it QUIT WORKING....  Froze up---will not Boot Up or turn on....  Will take it to Verizon Store in the AM....  If they can't fix it----Back it comes------

Reviews.Title: Best upgrade
Reviews.Author: Michael Plymail
Reviews.Content: Awesome phone. Upgraded from original galaxy s. This phone much more capable for my needs.  The increased mega pixels does a great job for pictures

Reviews.Title: Good, but previous version is better.

Doesn't have the battery life the S3 does, and has a few problems such as not connecting in some places, when there's clearly a hotspot. Reviews.Title: So much better than my last phone!
Reviews.Author: Spirit_Wolf
Reviews.Content: So, I got the galaxy s4 to replace my old droid razor.  I am extremely please with the new phone - especially the quality of the camera and the set up features.  I haven't had it long, but I can already say that it is much better than my old phone.

Reviews.Title: The Hype is Justified
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone and the Samsung version of Android on it is the best I've seen.  Had some weird issues at first that turned out to be a bad micro-sd card.  Not the phone's fault!!  Have tried HTC and Motorolla phones and this one has more features and gimmicks than I can use without being intrusive or interfering with basic phone operations.  Can't imagine what the S5 could improve on.

Reviews.Title: Amazing but with a few disappointments
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone. It has everything it is advertised with. I wasn't expecting to get the free headset, so that is a bonus. The only really disappointing thing about this phone is that despite having 2 gigs of RAM, you get to use less than 1 of them because the OS uses so much of it already. Don't get me wrong, the phone is still fast, and it hardly stutters on 3D games, but I figured I could get tons of multitasking out of it. Other wise, it lived up to all expectations, even the only having 9 gigs to work with on the phone itself. A big plus that I wasn't aware of though, is that you can move some select apps to your SD card. That makes this phones memory go a whole lot farther and the fact that it has an SD slot made it a pick over the LG G2. It still feels rather fragile and I am kind of worried about breaking it because my case has not arrived yet. But overall, I love the phone.

I have Iphone 5s, but now I'm thinking...this Galaxy phone beat the Iphone or are equal?. I Love the phone is sweet easy to work with it. I will recommend this phone is you are looking for a cool cell.

I had to take the battery out to reset it. I didn't expect that to happen seeing as though I've only had the phone for a month...but other than that one snafu, it's really a great phone.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Loren N.
Reviews.Content: No issues, first smart phone, works as advertised.  I would definately buy again.  Could do without the bloat ware, but not a huge issue.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: durango1025
Reviews.Content: I cant say anything bad about this phone pictures and video are great it comes with some bloatware that I wish I could move to the sd card but overall I just love it.

Reviews.Title: Cool Phone and Great Service
Reviews.Author: Cody Whitaker
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these, one for my wife and one for myself. They have lots of neat apps and they will do a whole lot more than I'll ever ask a phone to do. If you're like me and don't want a lot of apps running simultaneously, they are easy to turn off. The VZ Navigator has served me well on numerous occasions. Reviews.Title: Just love it
Reviews.Author: Mike "melnik_m"
Reviews.Content: Samsung, I love this phone. So far no problems whatsoever. Significant improvements from Galaxy 2. Love the size, the weight, everything

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Robert Petroshus
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite smartphone I've ever had. Great apps and function with small learning curve. Get this device now!

Reviews.Title: Love my Galaxy S
Reviews.Author: Ronda St George "Miriah"
Reviews.Content: I received my phone and have really enjoyed it. It meets all my expectations.I would recommend this phone to anyone

Reviews.Title: yeah.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "A slighty above average Joe"
Reviews.Content: There's nothing I can add. If you haven't already heard about the s4 read elsewhere. It is my favorite smart phone so far. I left LG for it and haven't looked back. Absolutely no regrets.

Reviews.Title: Best Smart Phone on the market
Reviews.Author: Hank Loudermelk

I suggested this for my son and daughter-n-law. they made me aware of app to use phone as a Remote control for TV, And Direct TV box. Reviews.Author: B. Marchus
Reviews.Content: For one penny how can I complain.  This is the 2nd phone I have purchased through Amazon Wireless.  If I went through verizon I would have paid $199.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade to a smart phone.

I was not a fan of Blackberries or I phones, so I chose the Galaxy. I am not disappointed at all. The only reason for the 4 stars is I don't "Love" any phone. Reviews.Content: while the screen is larger and the S4 has more memory, apps open less snappy than on my old HTC incredible. overall the phone feels slower with the exception of watching youtube videos, but that is mostly driven by 4G vs 3G.the camera has more megapixels, but the focus is much slower and significantly worse than on the incredible. I tried a few other camera apps but so far have not found anything that will give me quick and sharp pictures.pros: larger screen, more memorycons: poor camera, feels slow

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: James Shannon
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of reviews around for the S4 so not a real need to go into much more than what's been said already. Like any electronic device these days, be patient learning all the bells and whistles and their hidden features. If you can't find something you'd like to do, download the manual or search for it on the Internet. It's size is about as large as I'd want to go especially with a case on it. Batteries must be getting better because it lasts through the day. Of course, that all depends on how much usage it gets, what you leave on all the time like the GPS or anything pulling power you don't really need and when it does need to be charged, it seems to recharge fairly quick.

Reviews.Title: Phone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It will work very nice it seems really tuff so won't have to worry about the phone breaking  Thank you very much

Reviews.Title: Galaxy S4
Reviews.Author: Mark Sutherby
Reviews.Content: The Device was easy to connect and set up no problems.The device will take getting used to like any new technology will but I love it and I am happy I am with Verizon they have been good to me so far.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Arnold Morris
Reviews.Content: Just received this phone after review all the latest phones. For me the feature that keeps the screen active while you are watching it was important.  It is a royal pain when a screen times out especially when the person like my wife is a non tech.  Use the phone to show pictures of grandchildren and with my Droid it would time out and the person could not reactivate the screen.the battery life is good so far but have not really pushed it so far.Takes great pictures.Ring tones that come with the phone are not very loud or particularly appealing to me but easy to get your own.Only issue so far I have is with the the multi screen function. There only a limited number of apps that are available to use that way and I cant determine if that is by design or I just haven't found the right place in the  instructions. The apps that are available seem to work fine so have no complaints on that.

Reviews.Content: Great phone.  Super fast and intuitive.  Easy to use with the latest/greatest features on the market.  I've been a Samsung fan since I switched for Apple products.  I would never go back.  A+++

Reviews.Title: Best phone I've ever had

Reviews.Content: Really love my Samsung Galaxy S4! It has many features but not hard to operate. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Dean K "Dean"
Reviews.Content: Who needs an iPhone that limits you on where you can download stuff from and needs your permission for everything.  The phone works great, love the bigger screen size, not heavy and battery seems to last long.

Reviews.Title: 7 Months later!
Reviews.Author: JEXTREME
Reviews.Content: So I have had my Galaxy S4 for 7 months now and I must say I am still very pleased with my phone. Like all smart phones unless you are dealing with Motorola which are built stronger, I'd get a protective case, which aren't to expensive on amazon. I got an Iblason prime case which is fantastic. Nonetheless the phone's quad core processor is super speedy and doesn't lag often unless a lot is going on, and even then the lag is extremely nominal. One of the winning features I feel about this phone is the removable battery. After 6 months any phone's battery is going to not last as long. With many of the phone companies now with non-replaceable batteries you are screwed into a phone which becomes handicap after a year and by 2 you can absolutely notice the difference. Even though a couple phones are better than the S4 now I believe it really held its weight for months, which is not common, for example think about the new set of droids that came out this past year, which were already outdated when they came out besides having gigantic batteries which were not replaceable and would diminish over time. If the S4 goes down in price, I'd def recommend it as a still very competitive phone. Of course you'd want to get a newer phone, but for those who want a cheaper second line phone, at this time I'd absolutely recommend the Galaxy S4.

Reviews.Title: This thing is awesome
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: This thing is awesome.  Between this and my Galaxy Note I can get just about anything done.  I don't use my laptop any more.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S4
Reviews.Author: Chile Line Express @ Box Pack Mail
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful device.  More than met my expectations and I use it more than I imagined.  Nice to have another alternative to stationary computer.

Reviews.Title: Even better than I dreamed
Reviews.Author: MamaW
Reviews.Content: Used it now for only a few weeks but it is awesome. Great speed, screen resolution is terrific, battery life is better than I expected. I would definitely recommend this phone

Reviews.Title: Great Phone - not perfect, but great
Reviews.Author: Wai
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that it is a great phone, not perfect but I spend more than 2 weeks to play around with it. Don't need to download the individual app as I did to the HTC Increditible, my 6 years old phone. 16GB is just enough for normal use. A little confusing at first with the Samsung app and some of the app included, after a while, after sort out what app is good or non-sense, just turn the app off, at least I don't need the Yahoo mail app anymore, which crash the phone. It save memeory, battery, and data usage. you really have to play around with it to see how good it is. score 95 out of 100. nothing is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: John S. Kjellman
Reviews.Content: this is one of the nicest, fastest Android phones out there.  I'll keep this brief.ProsFast - fast - fast - quad core processorHD Display - the display on this is full 1920x1080 HD resolution and looks greatApps - Comes with tons of apps to do more things than one can count.  You really need to search the web for training materials as there is that much.Sensitive display - You can operate the touch screen without touching it or through regular gloves.ConsFragile screen - You drop it you broke it.  I ended up getting an Otterbox to protect mine.  Makes it a lot fatter but now it bounces when I drop it.Sensitive display - The display registers touches before you touch it.  This is mainly a problem if your fingers wrap around the device as you are handing it to someone or just holding it.  sometimes you trigger things you wish you hadn't.Power button placement - The power button is on the top right side and sensitive.  You can easily press it unintentionally.  The only thing that saves me here is my Otterbox makes this button more stiff.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm blown away by the capabilities in this lightweight phone. It is the Swiss army knives of smart phones where you can check e-mail, surf the web, get turn by turn directions, listen to virtually any radio station on the planet, take photos and videos where ever you go, remotely control your TV, and even make phone calls. The bright 5" screen has full HD resolution and it still fits in your shirt pocket. There are thousands of Apps available on the Google Play Store. The phone cost me $0.01 when I signed up to a 2 year contract. The phone is outstanding and the deal was simply unbeatable. The carrier sign up process was very smooth on the Amazon web page and I received the phone in two days. I highly recommended this device ordered through Amazon to anyone who needs a great smart phone.

Reviews.Author: SparkBigDreams
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical getting the S4 as I had the original Galaxy and it was absolute garbage. However, I've been nothing but impressed and please with this phone so far. I've had it for about 3 months now and haven't had any issues that haven't fixed themselves with a phone restart.However, it has recently randomly restarted itself a couple of times. The sensor by the earpiece that tells the phone if it is near your face is VERY sensitive. Don't put your hand anywhere near it when you are trying to do anything on screen or the screen will shut off. Quite frustrating when you don't know what is going on!

Reviews.Title: Hubby loves it!!!

Reviews.Content: My hubby is a fireman with huge hands.  This phone feels solid in his hands.  He was terribly afraid of dropping it since it feels rather slick, so we got him the Otterbox Defender.  He loves the clear screen & the lack of little things he had to set up!  Anyone could use this right out of the box he says!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Device
Reviews.Author: Roger Amchip "Here For You"
Reviews.Content: This is my second smart phone, the first having been the HTC Incredible 2. I love the large screen size and have now realized the speed and power of this phone. I dropped mine unprotected (from about 2 feet) getting out of my car and *boink* dead-screened. I normally carry it in an Otterbox Defender case, but not that night. SPEND SOME MONEY FOR A GOOD CASE. DOOOOOOO IT!While I was waiting for the warranty replacement, I used a friend's old Motorolla Droid HD and it made me aware of a few things. My first charge on the Droid lasted about 2.5 days with light use. I was amazed. Lucky to get a full day from the S4. That was the good. The bad was everything else - and I missed my S4. The resolution of the S4 screen is amazing compared to previous-generation phones. EVERYTHING is faster on the S4 from Facebook to using the internet browser. I would think any two 4G devices would get the same speed from the network, but the flippin Droid was getting about 4.5 MB on 4G whereas just now on my replacement S4 (sitting in the same chair at the same time of day, mind you) I just got 36.77 down and 21.12 up speeds with Ookla on Verizon Wireless network. I didn't even know those speeds were POSSIBLE. So I'm happy.Oh yeah, I also just ordered me a 5200 mAh extended battery for about $20. Worth a shot for that price (and a Seidio case to fit over the battery). Will review that after I've given it a whirl. Never tried an extended life battery but if ever there were a device worthy of one, this is it.My only regret is that the Galaxy Note 3 came out not long after I started my new 2 year contract...so now I want that one. Wonder what will be awesome in 2 years. Can't wait to see!

Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my husband for Christmas.  We both have an Iphone 4S, and he is in love with this new Samsung.  I'm quite jealous, I should have bought myself one!

Reviews.Content: Phone is just great, I especially like the operating system better than Iphone, the speakers/display and camera are more than I expected.

Reviews.Content: This phone has 1 con.....battery life. To utilize most of the features it has you wind up draining the battery. This cell phone does so much more than Apple's iPhone models and has a larger HD screen for great video viewing. I watched EPIC on it and it was clear and crisp. Everyone I showed said "WOW!" Delivery for these were within 48 business hours.

Reviews.Content: This is the 16gb version of the Samsung Galaxy S4. This entire line of devices is pretty good at earning positive reviews.  Purchasing brand new through Amazon cost me $200 less than purchasing direct from my cell phone service provider. I'd give 6 stars if that was an option.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Phone!

Reviews.Content: Great features, speed and awesome phone. Verizon coverage is good. Add an S-View flip cover and you're good to go.

Reviews.Author: Bryan Scown
Reviews.Content: I've had many android devices, but never a Samsung. The S4 blows both my Evos out of the water in every imaginable category *EXCEPT* the fact that Samsung has installed a bunch of garbage apps and also manages the phone's automatic updates. I don't have a problem with getting updates, but I do have a problem getting OTA updates that cost me data. The screen quality is unmatched, the call quality is terrific, and the phone's size is super slim.

Reviews.Title: Great phone

Reviews.Content: I got my S4 within 2-days of ordering.  You know the phone is technologically amazing!!!  You can buy it ANYWHERE...but I'll share something with you.  Amazon, as usual, had the best price and the fastest service that I could find.  Once it arrived, I Put in the sim card and was off to the races. Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to replace my phone when my contract expired. It works great. It could take a little better pictures and have a better zoom on the camera, action shots are hard to take.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera and awesome features.
Reviews.Author: Niceun
Reviews.Content: Before this phone I had a Droid Bionic, which I like very much and never had any issues with it. The Galaxy S4 has a large screen and very clear and vibrant colors. A great feature on this phone that I discovered is while you are viewing a text message you can increase the volume button and it makes the text bigger or you can decrease the volume and the text gets smaller. Very handy when you don't have your glassed on and need the text to be larger. I have had the phone about 3 weeks and have not had any issues. The camera and options are awesome. Also makes some cool videos with the picture in picture feature. You can record video of say your family and all the while the rear facing camera is filming you in a little box on the screen! I would for sure recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Almost same as Note 3 except the screen size - really like this phone
Reviews.Author: Kobridge
Reviews.Content: Perfect phone for my kids. Spent no dollars for this phone during the Black Friday sales.Love it and hope no more Galaxy S series until my contract ends :)

Reviews.Title: The Best Smartphone, but needs Protective Case
Reviews.Author: David H. Reed
Reviews.Content: This phone is fabulous--a huge improvement over my Droid X.  App launcher works perfectly, screen is big and bright, endless options for customization.  Apps are lightning fast, integration with Google features is perfect.  Camera is the BEST, challenges my array of Nikon and Canon pocket cameras for quality.  The phone is very light weight and a bit delicate--I damaged it a bit the first time I dropped it, but was able to repair it myself.  I added a $20 Body Glove case, which makes the phone at least as rugged as my Droid X, but also as heavy or heavier than the Droid X.

Reviews.Content: It does everything I want and more than I will ever use. Glad I bought it as my first smartphone!

Reviews.Title: useless features, but nice big screen size.
Reviews.Author: Hoon Ik Cho
Reviews.Content: If you people have a choice, go for the Google Play edition(Yes I know that you can install custom rom). For Verizon I know that there isn't a Google Play edition S4, but if you have a choice to go for T-mo or AT&T; and MUST use Galaxy S4, then buy the Play edition. Not that I'm saying the Verizon's coverage service is bad or anything, but with all the bloatwares pre-installed and the good 'ol horrible Touch-Wiz(yeah it did improve a LOT compared to older versions).I think all that eye gesture features are just useless... I mean it's really cool for the first few weeks but after that, those features just don't come all that handy in real life situation. If there was one gesture feature that I ACTUALLY used in real life, that's probably the wave above the phone to answer the phone call in speaker phone. Besides that, I don't remember other features being useful at all. Especially the features that tracks the eye movements... it uses camera the whole time so it drains the hell out of your battery plus makes the phone slower(in my case at least. after turning it off I saw a significant battery life improvement as well as performance).Lastly, I found this phone a bit awkward to hold.Now above was all the hate part, below is what I actually liked about this phone.The screen. Wow. I've been an iPhone user for multiple years, and I gotta say that the Apple's displayes are really high quality. Well this phone isn't like... the same level of quality but it's very high quality in different ways. Colors are vibrant and clear(some don't like thie but I like super colorful displays). and the Full-HD resolution on this device makes the texts really good looking.Screen size... was a bit awkward in my opinion. I do like the big size, but I wish it was just either bigger, or smaller(I'd much prefer the S3's screen size.). But in general, the bigger screen size was refreshing and nice for viewing media.However I don't think i'll go back to Samsung phones again. Unless it's the Google Play Editions..

Reviews.Title: Great Phone

Reviews.Content: Believe the hype. This smartphone is awesome. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about it. This is my third android phone and I can't understand why anyone would want a different operating system.

Reviews.Content: Replaced an S3.  Battery life much better, more features.  Fast processor very quick.  Pictures, videos benefit from bright hi-res display.

Reviews.Title: Great phone

Reviews.Content: Great phone that is easy to use and has far to many features to mention. The size was a concern when I ordered it, but it is cSo easy to view that I use it more and my PC less!

I live in an area that can have low reception for time to time and unfortunately it would loose 4g quiet often in theses areas.Compare it to say a Note 2 to that i bought about 5 month ago the Note 2 never lost 4g or dropped a call.It would hang on to one bar where the S4 would lose signal and cut out. I was skeptical about that.  But it all worked out.I have nothing bad to say about the phone.  I've had it since June.

Reviews.Title: Very User Friendly
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "I'm paranoiac in reverse - I...
Reviews.Content: I love my S4. Previously I had used a Droid Bionic 2, but both my husband and I's phones gave up the ghost two weeks before our contract was to renew with Verizon, so we impatiently awaited our opportunity to upgrade. My husband is a bit of a techhie, and had spec'd this phone out previously, and it met all of his qualifications. For me, it's just been awesome to use. It's got a very user friendly Droid interface, and it was easy to transfer over my songs and apps. Most of my apps work better on the S4 than they did on the Bionic - and I mostly use my phone for Facebook, texting, Pinterest, and Twitter. Nothing too fancy, but I don't have the same delays, page stalling, and forced program closures that I'd had before.My one beef is my texting app is not as sensitive to my randomness as the Bionic 2. Often it corrects words to say the complete opposite of what I'm trying to convey, and the speech to text is just awful. It is kind of fun to see what it comes up with though, if I'm trying to send a speech to text message while driving or busy. S Voice has been fun to play with as well, and she's smart enough to know that the meaning of life is 42 (and cited the correct sources as well). All in all, despite the texting snafus (which would be solved if I typed slower or took the time to stop hating Swype), it's a fantastic phone. I only wish that the waterproof model had been available at the time of purchase.Amazon had the best price with Prime shipping, of course, and we didn't have to worry about filling out any rebate forms, which was pretty handy.

Reviews.Title: my favorite phone
Reviews.Author: danw2016
Reviews.Content: This phone is very nice. I like that it has a big screen and a decent battery life. I think that this phone is more advanced than most. The only complaint I have is if you are buying it without a phone contract, it is really expensive.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Galaxy S4
Reviews.Author: Time to Read "time to read"
Reviews.Content: I did not get this phone though Amazon, I got it at the local Sprint store.  I had the S3 and liked it but it was a tad slow.  My husband and I got the S4s bogo, last week when we were due for upgrades.  I have to say that I love the new Galaxy S4.  It is really fast!!  One feature that I love is that you can share photos and files with other s4 device owners by touching the phones together and hitting send.
