I was surprised to see that most of our area for Sprint is now 4G which makes the phones even faster.  Downloads are amazingly fast.  I also love the auto scroll feature, and the voice recognition.Overall,  I think it's a great phone that will keep me happy until my next upgrade! PS my husband loves his too!  He said it's the best phone he has ever had!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S IV
Reviews.Author: Lee Powell
Reviews.Content: Great phone with a wonderful display.  Easy to read and navigate.  Extremely fast with the 4G.  Downloading apps is really fast and opening the apps is a flash.  Great phone!!

Reviews.Title: Great Verizon Phone
Reviews.Author: R. Salas
Reviews.Content: The phone lives up to all the hype and so reliable on the Verizon Network, I give 5 stars for a great device and software, but the gestures are still a little Gimicky and they do work. I'm coming from a HTC Rezound, Iphone 5

Reviews.Title: My Favorite Phone Yet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Addict
Reviews.Content: My last phone was a Motorola Droid and man this thing is a big step up. Tons more features, larger screen, crisp display, it's great. I previously owned an iPhone as well and I like this S4 much better. Good job Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Samsung hits another one out of the park!
Reviews.Author: Ericka Boehnlein
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th Android based smartphone, and by far the best to date. This thing feels solid, while not heavy, and looks amazing. The performance is everything I expected it to be, and makes for a solid smartphone for the performance demanding user.

Reviews.Title: so far so good, except bluetooth
Reviews.Author: Brian S Pak
Reviews.Content: Fast, fast, fast. Great video & camera! Love being able to turn off open apps/windows or toggling back to different apps/windows quickly. Have been streaming music and playing thru bluetooth to speakers. Bluetooth signal is the weakest of all phones owned in the past since bluetooth became available. Very disappointed w/ this feature. Need to have phone less than 10 feet away and not stand between phone & bluetooth device or even have your arm between. It is worse than my friends Galaxy s3. Only negative thing w/ phone since purchase thus far.

Reviews.Title: Fell in love the first day!
Reviews.Author: Recovery D
Reviews.Content: I bought a DNA and had problems with it within first week. Then returned it. I thought I would give it another try a couple months later and same issues. Ended up going through 3 of them. Amazon got my upgrade reversed and I waited for this to come out. I am so glad I did! The features will blow you away. You can play with the phone for hours and still not know all that it can do. It is lightning fast at everything. All my apps were downloaded by the time it was all set up. I would reccomend this phone to extream smartphone android people as well as first time smartphoners. It even has a setting to make the screens easier to learn for people just getting into smartphones.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed about weak AMOLED screen
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to upgrade to from my Samsung Galaxy S to the S4.  It's a nice phone overall with a major drawback:  the AMOLED screen is as fragile as an eggshell.  I dropped mine from ~1ft off the ground and the AMOLED screen broke.  The gorilla glass is fine.While doing some research, there are many reports of the screen breaking while sitting in a user's front pants pocket.  According to reports, Samsung knows about this and is fixing the problem in phones released 3+ months after launch.  Very disappointed in the standard durability expected of a cell phone.  Samsung has lost a customer for life.

Reviews.Title: Black screen of death in less than 1 day
Reviews.Author: David Lee
Reviews.Content: I am an android fan. I have a samsung galaxy note 8. I use a samsung galaxy note 2. I bought my parents each galaxy s3 phones and my wife had a galaxy s3 phone until I upgraded it to the s4. We just activated it two days ago, and although great, and my wife was really excited about it--> by the end of the day, the display died. Just flat out died and with no drops or any reason for the mishap. She can still hear her text messages and phone calls coming in, but she has no way to answer or to respond. We've taken out the battery and restarted it multiple times, with tech support tried a hard reset, still nothing on the screen at all. Just the little blue indicator LED light saying, "you are missing out on some text messages" but you can't do anything about it.Anyways - so I'm concerned about the quality here. if HTC one was available on verizon, I might consider that instead.At least amazon service is pretty good. They will send out another phone overnight (although I get charged the full 600+ bucks for it) and then they will refund it once I get the broken phone back.My other gripe now is that there's no way to really hard reset this b/c even if I press the button combination, I don't know how to select the actual choice because I can't see the screen to confirm a factory reset.So Now we send it back with gmail acct, kindle, amazon, all those apps are available for someone to see.

Reviews.Title: WORST DISASTER EVER - DO NOT BUY SAMSUNG EVER!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Paul Mooney
Reviews.Content: On this night I am attempting to recover my video files that mysteriously disappeared from my phone.  I am about 6 hours into the task.  Transferring files has always been easy on past phones...  But this is Samsung.  And that has been the least of my problems, although I am not happy about it.  I lost some absolutely irreplaceable footage.I bought the best phone (so I thought) because I run a business, and I have to have reliability and the best quality for speaking to vendors and customers continuously throughout the day.  I also like to use the video and camera features - and yes I like to use a lot the phone has to offer.  But of course over the past several months I have found myself using it less and less, because the features do not work.First of all forget all the fu-fu bs apps this phone offers!  The wave your hand thing over the phone (ooooh sooo cool!) is the most ridiculous, worst waste of time.  If you don't disable it, it will drive you crazy because any shadow, false move, makes the phone do something you don't want.  It is a pain in the a*****!!!  Same is true for most of those "advanced" features.  I won't go through them.  I tried so many that I ended up disabling for similar reasons.Allow me to tell you about the MAJOR DISASTER this phone caused me...  I use Dropbox for my business so I can work on files in multiple locations.  I also sync my phone to it so I can access a file from my phone on some rare occasions.  I never had a problem with my HTC One.  It would sync the file names to the phone and then when I would try to access the file it would download the contents.  Meanwhile any photos or videos were automatically synced.  Perfect!  Well the geniuses at Samsung have their phones programed to do things a little differently.  Without getting into the details of how it all works... I'll just give you the summarized version.  Basically, Samsung syncs with Dropbox completely, so the phone started downloading all my office files in their entirety!  Plus they have their own cloud software that links to your dropbox files somehow without you knowing it (that's another story).  To make a long story short, the phone malfunctioned and deleted thousands of my business files ON ALL MY COMPUTERS!!!!!!  I watched the files being deleted.  Within minutes thousands were gone before I could shut the process down.  If you understand a little about Dropbox, you can understand how this can happen when you have a crappy device linked to it.  In my discussions with Dropbox they explained how the Samsung programming causes this to happen.  {So, I had to work with some moron (who seemed like some ditzy teenager) over at Dropbox to recover my business files.  That took a week to get straightened out.  My business was basically shut down for a week.  Dropbox is NOT a good file backup system by the way.  I had to learn the hard way.}  SO this GD phone cost me, I don't know, maybe ten thousand dollars in lost business?So, I don't sync Dropbox to my phone.  To sync files I have to use other means ALL WHICH SUCK!!!  The Kies software is a nightmare to use!  It doesn't work and you have to install and update this software and that just to get it working only to find out that other pieces of software (explorer & firefox for example) will only work if you use OLDER versions.  I mean holy S*****!!!  WT***?One more thing to note, this is my third Samsung Galaxy S4.  Yes I have had to replace it for malfunctions and problems that were unrepairable that I have not mentioned here.  I would demand a replacement for my current handset, but I am so sick of trading out files, recreating all of my settings, and dealing with all the hassels...  I am just going to get a different phone as soon as possible.  Probably something other than Android.  I just want something that works.In the meantime, I just use my Samsung phone basically for phone calls.

Reviews.Title: Great phone, kept my unlimited data with Verizon!
Reviews.Author: Mike Lindberg
Reviews.Content: Phone arrived factory sealed and perfect. Charged it and turned on, no SIM card. This worried me as I only had a 3G phone with Verizon. I paid full price for this  phone to keep that plan. Took old and new phones to Verizon, no issue at all. They installed and activated new phone with a new 4G SIM card and I kept my plan, whew!

Reviews.Title: Quality Control Suffers!!
Reviews.Author: JON WADLEY
Reviews.Content: FYI - Purchased Samsung Galaxy S4 on 10/31/13.  Enjoyed it for 19 days before it died.  Lost spreadsheets, calendar, pictures, everything.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 4 months
Reviews.Author: temp
Reviews.Content: I had an HTC Incredible that lasted 4 years.  The S4 has lasted 4 months and it seems to have died.  Before that it was a little weak, where it is impossible to input anything right after unplugging a charger, so if you unplug right before trying to answer it won't unlock in time to accept the call.  4G seems exactly the same speed as 3G, so that wasn't an improvement.  After some testing the problem is that it will not charge or connect to computer with USB.  Not too strange of an issue but it's still more of a pain than I'm used to with phones.

Reviews.Title: Battery problem
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had this phone for almost a month. Hooked to charger and the next morning the phone was very warm to the touch. I didn't pay attention to that, but the battery had been lasting at least 2 days before needing a charge, and by the evening it was down to 7%. I plugged it in and the next morning it was extremely hot. The battery said it was 100% charged.  After about an hour, I went to use the phone, it was still very hot and the battery was almost dead. I went to forums about this problem and found many saying they had similar problem with the battery. I had called the  Verizon store to ask about it, but was put on hold for about 45 minutes till I gave up on them. I sent  it back. Luckily I still had 1 day to return it within the 30 days that Amazon gives you.

Reviews.Title: Great price from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So glad Amazon is handling the Samsung for Verizon Wireless! I have waited for a great price and that's what I got.

Reviews.Title: Best phone
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: I love this phone.  It is great, its fast and does more than any phone I have ever had ever.

Reviews.Title: screen and operating system excellent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I upgraded for two reasons; screen size/clarity and the new Android op system. Both have turned out to be a joy to use.

Reviews.Title: Coming from an iPhone to the Galaxy S4
Reviews.Author: A Techy Guy
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Galaxy S4 about a month ago and could not be happier. I was coming from an iPhone 5 and it does not even compare. At first I was a little skeptical about making the switch but i am very glad i did. The screen on the Galaxy s4 is beautiful, every pixel just pops out of the OLED display with videos and pictures looking super crisp. The operating system it shipped with was 4.2 and has a lot of great features. I personally like the fact that I can customize the phone the way I want it, whether it be another messaging app or changing the way icons look. This is the beauty of the Android operating system. The processor and ram keep things speedy with multitasking a breeze as well as scrolling through websites. I used to have to close my apps on my old iPhone if I went above 5 but the Galaxy can handle a lot more with sometimes having open ten applications at a time and seeing no relative decrease in speed. The battery on this thing is amazing with a charge lasting well into the next day. I use the phone most of the day including playing games, surfing the web, making calls, and texts. I take it off of the charger at 9am and when I go to bed around 12am with about 40% battery left. The only drawback of this phone that I don't particularity like is the construction of the phone. The design feels a little cheap in your hand compared to some competitors. All in all I give this phone a 5 out of 5. If your considering going from an iPhone to the Galaxy I defiantly recommend it, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Phone
Reviews.Author: Michealah Garska
Reviews.Content: I am so glad that I picked this phone is is great. I have had it now for over a month and I have not had any problems with it like I have with other phones. My husband also has this phone and I have not heard him say once "you piece of s***" like he has with our other phones. I would recommend this phone to anyone. The battery life is great I have gotten 12-18 hours of very heavy use out of it from day one. I honestly dont think that I could ask for a better phone.

Reviews.Title: on the first day, very impressed, but read on...
Reviews.Author: Tim  Isenhour "Timbo"
Reviews.Content: No where in the description does it state that the phone is NOT shipped with a SIMM card.  Since they asked what provider you are using it with, that should have been enough to provide the correct SIMM card.  But anyways, one of the most recent reviews told me all that I needed to do and all is well now.  That is take the phone to your local store and they will put in the SIMM.  If you don't have a local provider, I suggest you contact your mobile provider BEFORE you purchase this phone because it WILLNOT work with out a SIMM.  I hope this makes sense and will hopefully save anyone the heartache of buying a "brick" and not being able to use it right out of the box.I wanted a larger screen without carrying around a tablet; this is accomplished with this phone. It's not that much larger than my Rezound, but the screen size is huge compared to it.As most have also stated, the phone is VERY light, and thus, probably very easy to break! I ordered the otter defender along with this phone and it seems very adequate in protecting it from all types of damage; well common sense damage; you still can't drop in in water!You will still have to RE-download all of your apps, and reinstall them, from scratch, even if you move the SD card from your old phone to a new one.  So, before you do all this, write down all of your important data like passwords and user names so the migration is not so hard.I've made one phone call so far, and it was from NC to Ala. and also to a different provider and the quality was better than I had expected after reading other reviews.  No hollow sounds, no breakups or the such.Data transfers are super fast with this phone over my HTC.Also, the setup of things like email accounts and the such are also much easier now, but I think that is due to the software differences between both phone more than the actual phones. There's two major upgrade numbers between the HTC and this phone.Over all, I love this phone and would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: SmartBoy
Reviews.Content: I switched from iPhone 4S to Galaxy S4.....I am very happy with the move. s4 is awesome. Now after using s4, iPhone feels so antiquated.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Marshall Flanigan
Reviews.Content: Best Phone I have ever owned..My friends want this phone. I love it. Got rid of an HTC EVO for this phone. Battery Life is great

Reviews.Title: it is everything I hoped it would be
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: The best phone hands down. Samsung is definitely the standard by which all mobile phones are judged, and it is a high standard

Reviews.Title: Fast and easy, not too big.
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: This phone is smooth and doesn't eat battery as much as I would have expected. This phone is actually closer in size to the S2 than the S3, from what I can tell. So, the phone fits in your pocket well. The additional screen landscape comes from better packaging. I am an old-school Galaxy user, so recommend the Seidio Surface line of cases. Some people went with Flygrip or Otterbox. I just didn't like the bulk/protection ratio for those brands. Surface is the sweet spot for me.Stock ROM: Jellybean, Touchwiz, of course it is locked. TONS of bloatware from Amazon, Samsung and Verizon. Even with the bloat, the phone runs pretty well. Unfortunately the phone tries to inject itself into many portions of your life. While some people may enjoy this, I don't need to be inter-connected to work, facebook and messaging 24/7.  The Stock ROM/Kernel is easy to root at this point in time. There is a good core group of developers supporting rooting and customizing this phone.Custom recoveries: They are easy to find. I recommend TWRP.Custom Kernels: You pretty much have to run a LOKI'd kernel for customizing this phone.Custom ROMs: The two most popular are Hyperdrive and Beans. Both are solid upgrades.

Reviews.Title: Great device, but terrible phone
Reviews.Author: Jay89ls6
Reviews.Content: I will agree that all the pros of the s4 are true i.e. great screen, camera, light weight,great processor, good battery life mine has not gone below 50% since I've had it, but for me I am very picky and I dislike the UI of this phone. The previous phone I had was an HTC so things on that phone I liked and some I hated.1. On the S4 I hate how when I press the icon to make a call it will always take me to the keypad, which to me would be fine if it showed recent calls above it where there is currently an empty white space. The HTC phone did exactly what I wanted, showed the keypad and recent calls when the same icon was pressed. I am trying to get in the habit of using the speed dial feature and Google now because if I start typing the name of someone I want to call, it will display information from one person in my contacts and a drop box next to that info when clicked will reveal the other numerous contacts (sometimes 25) I might be trying to call. This is terrible because I feel it should be predictive and remember which numbers are called more frequently and take those up to the top of the list. To Samsung's credit though I like their tab called favorites. It displays frequently contacted contacts. If the phone were able to let me choose which tab was opened when the phone icon was clicked, I would choose favorites, but as far as I know the UI won't let me. It always comes up with the keypad and a blank space above it.2.  I dislike the preloaded widgets and lock screens. The clock widgets won't let me click on them to view or modify any alarms unless I choose the widget called alarm(stupid widget which only displays which days one of my alarms is set for and the time it will go off). I was able to find an app called "easy clock widget". This app allows me to modify my alarms, activate the stopwatch, and start a timer. I miss being able to have the four customizable icons/apps on the lock screen. With the S4 I'm stuck with a clock and a customizable message I can add.3. The calendar widget does not allow me to swipe up and down in order to view a different month, so it makes me click on small icons in the upper corners.This link here http://youtu.be/RHIXtw34wK4 points out some other weak points about the s4 which would take me quite some time to explain on here. I decided to share my dislikes because most people have not pointed them out. In reality all the complaints I have regarding the phone can be fixed in a software update, but I feel it would be more likely they are fixed on their next galaxy s phone they come out with.  I've used the note 2 and for some reason I remember having a better UI and was just more well thought out. To me it seems this phone was just rushed out. The S4 has some new features which are not available on other smartphones yet, but when it comes to the basics, the S4 isn't so good.  So it is a great device, but not a great phone at least for me.

Reviews.Title: Took 3 different phones to get one lacking serious flaws
Reviews.Author: Shelly W Peters
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star phone if you're lucky enough to get a well built one. I am now on my third Galaxy S4. The first one I purchased from Verizon and it was defective. The motion swipe sensor did not work at all and I had to exchange it for a new one.The second phone seemed ok, but, I didn't know any better until an unfortunate drop of the phone shattered the screen. Screen replacement for these phones right after its release was running about half the total cost of the phone if bought outright. I decided to buy a new one outright from Amazon and sell the broken one.The third phone performed head and shoulders above the second and first phone. Apps loaded quickly and there was little lag time from the processor unlike the second phone. The second S4 had terrible lag times and app loading speeds. I was really wondering how this was supposed to be a flagship Android. I recently discovered the audio out jack on my third phone has some flaw where it produces static and feedback when plugged into my car. Frankly, it's not worth the trouble of setting up all my apps and screens to send it back over this issue. Luckily, one of my cars has the ability to stream music via bluetooth connection.I would have never known my second phone was faulty unless I had broken it and got a third. It's disappointing a product that has potential to be the best on the market to only be handcuffed by terrible Quality Control.I've owned multiple iPhones and Androids alike. While I've decided to make my permanent camp with Android, I really hope to see manufacturers like Samsung employing a build quality worthy of this price point.

Reviews.Title: New gesturing and eye tracking features draw down your battery!
Reviews.Author: Yo daddy "Don't blame me, I'm just the messen...
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for the gesturing and eye-tracking. Both are difficult to use, and cut my battery life in half. I tried to impress my friends with the hand/eye features, but just ended up looking dumb when I couldn't get them to work consistently.Maybe it takes practice, I don't know.My phone stayed hot too. (even when idle) I finally had to disable them or else keep charging my phone twice a day.Why would I buy a phone for features I can't even use?Some other observations.The screen is awesome!The call quality is good.The camera is good, but not great.The phone is VERY light.The battery life is normal with all the bells and whistles turned off.The phone has the same glitchy-ness found in all Android phones. In fact, I've had to restart it three times in the four days I've had it just for setting changes to show up. I also had one lock up.I bought mine directly from VERIZON, but they won't accept my review despite re-writing it several times. (maybe because it's not 5 stars)Don't get me wrong, it's a nice phone, but I can't use the things I bought it for!I wanted to like this phone so bad, but I find myself just disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great phone with a quirk
Reviews.Author: M. Murray
Reviews.Content: I like the phone and all the features.  I just have one quirky problem.  The blue tooth does not automattically connect with my car.  I have to manually connect it everytime I start my car.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great phone. I'm 60, finally upgraded, sorry I waited so long. Easy to use. Takes so getting use to but lovin it

Reviews.Title: Not as amazing as everyone says.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Signatures are onerous."
Reviews.Content: I "upgraded" to a Galaxy S4 from an Iphone 4.  So far I wish I had gotten an Iphone 5. The large screen on the Galaxy S4 is nice, but what they don't tell you is that you pay a huge price in battery life. Even with the screen brightness turned almost all the way down and all unnecessary apps closed, the battery doesn't even last me a full day. And it's not like I watch videos and listen to music all day. Compared to the performance of the Iphone's battery, the GS4's blows. Also, texting on the GS4 is not as smooth as it is on the Iphone. When you use a symbol or punctuation mark (yes, some of us actually do use proper punctuation), the virtual keyboard should automatically revert back to the regular letter keyboard, as it does on the Iphone, because a punctuation mark is almost always followed by a letter. The fact that the GS4's virtual keyboard does not do this requires an extra press of the shift key, which is a big pain in the butt because it is constantly interrupting the flow of your texting. Also, the GS4 does not have a good selection of text and ring tones. They're all too quiet.Another problem I've noticed with the GS4 is the internet browser is glitchy and prone to freezing. I've had to reload pages many times because the page I was on went dead. Other disadvantages: the model that comes with the Verizon deal has only 16 gigs of storage. If you want more, you have to pay 30 to 50 dollars for an SD card. Another big negative is that there is no equalizer function for fine-tuning the sound of your music. All you can do is adjust the volume. One other thing that is very annoying is that every time someone sends me a text, I also get an email of that text. I've searched everywhere in my phone and have found no way to turn that ridiculous option off.I realize I haven't become completely familiar with all the features of my GS4 yet, but from what I've seen so far I think I'll be going back to the Iphone.

Reviews.Title: Not user intuitive at all. You'll be asking "Why did they do it this way"? Also a very "buggy" phone.
Reviews.Author: Gregory B.
Reviews.Content: Using this phone is like driving the longest possible route to your destination. I have been a user of 2 other Android phones in the past (LG and Incredible 2) and had no trouble navigating through those phones. This phone it seems was set up to defy logic. Way too many steps to do anything. Try using bookmarks. Try navigating through e-mail and messaging. What a joke. This happens across the whole navigation platform of the phone. Navigating on this phone is like one big design flaw. And no, I'm not an iphone tout. Phone also seems to be very "buggy" with various fits and starts, forced closes and freezes throughout normal use. Very annoying. This phone has been a big disappointment. The one star is for the perfect screen size. Maybe the S5 will be an improvement.

Reviews.Title: Not for me.
Reviews.Author: kimberly
Reviews.Content: I kept this phone but gave it to my husband. It was my upgrade. I really didn't like the phone at all. I have had every phone available. My prior phone before getting this S4 was the Galaxy Note 2. After having a larger phone I just wasn't satisfied with the smaller S4. Writing this review based on my husband's overview of the phone. Many features never use. Except for the camera and television remote(which does not work properly and he doesn't use it anyway) is pretty much the same as the S3.  I personally used his upgrade to get the new HTC M8. Which I also returned and got the Note3. Has all the features of the S4 but better and has a stylus pen. I say if you are going to spend your money on a phone get a phone you're happy with. Go to the store and handle the phones and see what suits you. At first I was put off by size of Note 3 but I thought give it a week(you always have that grace period in which to return) after a week with the Note 3 I'm in love. Would not trade it for any phone out there even if I could get it free. On the other side... If you're happy with the size of the S4 I would still say wait for the S5 to be released. A much better upgrade from the S4. A friend of mine got one from Best Buy and it's a great phone. I still wouldn't trade my Note3 though.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for $100 or less
Reviews.Author: MG
Reviews.Content: Got the S34 about 6 months ago. I am no techie, so I have not even attempted to do everything that this phone will do. But the basics that I do are performed very well. I am glad that I got it.

Reviews.Title: Verizon and Galaxy S4
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: As a first time user, I needed more training with the phone than what I got at a weekend class at Verizon.Still figuring out what it's supposed to do, by continuing reading the manual.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!!!
Reviews.Author: Gregory
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my Samsung Galaxy S4. It is truely a great product. No issues with battery life and all of the other issues many people were unhappy with. I have nothing but good things to say.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievably Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Michael F. Baxter
Reviews.Content: And for only a penny?  It was too much to resist.  Yes, I know the Galaxy S5 is on the horizon, but it will be somewhat expensive for quite a while.  This great phone was immediately available and is so much better than the Galaxy S2 it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone!
Reviews.Author: Donna Huey
Reviews.Content: I was wanting to return to Verizon, but was hesitating waiting for the price of this phone to go down. At Verizon, it was $199.00 for a new contract. Through Amazon, I bought the phone for $.01!!!! What a deal, and it was so easy to activate, transfer data, etc. from my old phone and provider to the new one. Best deal ever, I am so thrilled.

Reviews.Title: Saved $400 with Amazon
Reviews.Author: IA
Reviews.Content: If you want to know about the phone their are plenty of reviews.  I was hesitant to buy a phone through the internet but it was so easy-took about 15 minutes to get the phones up and running after they were charged up.  I say phones because I got one for my hubby too.  So, these were $200 in the Verizon store and the day I ordered on Amazon they were 1 cent!  The next day they were $99 so I don't know if I got a special deal but if you see it for a penny you better not wait! So we saved $400 plus tax!  It was the exact same phone I would have received at the store-brand new-connected to my existing Verizon account.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed. Feels very cheap.
Reviews.Author: Maria Rose
Reviews.Content: The S4 is constructed of what feels like cheap plastic and is as light as a feather. Whatever the back is made of is not fingerprint proof - it seems to attract every smudge and oil possible. The flimsy build/weight actually makes it harder for me to hold the phone, which seems like a dumb problem to have. It just feels like a cheap toy.Not sure I care for the software. Comes with an absolutely excessive amount of bloatware. Had four (FOUR!) pages of apps pre-installed, and you can fit 20 apps on a page. Come on. I like the whole concept of 'widgets', so that was a cool feature. For my job I often need a clock with a second hand, and phone does not have one (just a pet peeve there).As for battery life, out of the box it lasted me about a day. After twelve hours of light use the battery was at 58%. Not too impressive.Phone has a very steep learning curve - I've had to google how to do even seemingly simple things on the phone, like for example turning off haptic keypresses (phone vibrates after every keypress on a keyboard), since disabling it in the system settings didn't work (really?). It has to be disabled in at least three different places, including sound settings in the system settings, two different keyboard settings, etc. Menus are not intuitive at all. Also don't care for the phone's integration with google. It's a nice option to have, but the phone tries very hard to make it mandatory. I don't use google except as a search engine, so I don't care for the phone's pushy insistence that I use google for everything from email to music.Just overall I'm not impressed. Reviews.Title: Well done Samsung!
Reviews.Author: D-Man
Reviews.Content: I bought the original Droid a few days after it came out and have been an android user ever since.  I am also fully integrated with the Google/Android world.  The Samsung Galaxy S4 is an AWESOME phone! I beleive it's the best android phone currently out.  The camera is amazing!  High quality photos with great editing features.  Battery life is going to be user based.  If you do a lot of game playing, like the screen on bright (versus auto setting), or do a lot of heavy web browsing, you will notice the battery drains faily quick (under 10 hours).  I turned off a lot of the features (even though they are cool, I don't use them enough to leave on) and disabled/uninstalled several applications. I get a solid day out of the battery with moderate-heavy use. The only phone that I have seen that single handedly beats the S4's battery life is the droid razr maxx...but who wants that clunker with a budget camera when you have a slick device like the S4 out there??  If you are just talking on your phone or have it on standby you will have no issue with the batter life. It's true the display is a little hard to see in the sunlight, but how much are you on your phone in the sun? I live in FL and have no issue with it.  Get this phone! It's a solid android phone! Samsung really thought through the features and functionality!

Reviews.Title: The S in S4 is short for a 4 letter word...Samsung 4S#!^
Reviews.Author: DNick
Reviews.Content: This phone has all the nifty bells and whistles when it comes to applications you may or may not use and the camera is in fact quite impressive. However, when one thinks about what the primary function of a phone is these days, it is to make/receive phone calls and to send text or emails, right?This phone's onscreen Keyboard is the absolute worst I have ever, and I mean ever had (and this is coming from someone who does not like the Iphone). The Samsung S4 will navigate through countless applications quickly and with ease, even open up multiple applications simultaneously!! But it cant tell what damn letter of the alphabet you are selecting when sending a text or email. Seriously, if you like typing redundantly and/or depending on the voice recognition system to tell you which words it thinks you meant, this phone is for you. Do yourself a favor before you even think about buying the S4 and play with the onscreen keyboard (wish I had before I shelled out the money for this POS). You will regret even thinking about purchasing it. Even when you see the correct letter highlighted when selecting it on the screen, the stupid phone will type the wrong letter. No, this isnt a chance defect with the unit I bought as my frustration lead to me ask a colleague at work who had the exact same phone. They confirmed that text/email typing is an enormous pain and that they depend more on the voice recognition system which doesnt always work as expected. For a phone touted and being praised by so many as the best ever, I wonder what those people are using the phone for. If all you use it for is to make buddies look dumb on airplane flights, playing mind numbing games like angry birds and/or using Skype to communicate when not interupted by connectivity issues, then those favorable reviews all makes sense now... I have no special interest steering people away from the S4 other than the plain fact the keyboard is the absolute worst and Samsung needs to get that corrected.

Reviews.Content: Seriously just google Galaxy S4 amoled screen crack and you will find many stories and videos of people who just by carrying the phone in their pocket had the screen crack rendering the phone completely useless. Now the screen that cracks isn't highly touted Gorilla 3 glass no it's the much more fragile screen underneath that the Gorilla glass is supposed to protect. I know this first hand because it happened to mine. If you get your insurance to cover it you're looking at a 100+ dollar deductible and Samsung won't acknowledge their horrible design flaw and want you to fork out $200 to repair their defect. A portable device should be pocket friendly mine was even in a protective case as was just about everyone else's this happened to. I wasn't on a construction site or in a hurricane I was merely walking with it in my pocket. User damage is random the damage will occur at the point of impact. This is most definitely a manufacturer design flaw as the crack always starts in the same place for everyone this happens too. I strongly urge you to heed this warning and not put yourself in the position I am right now. This is on par with the Red Ring of Death that took out a high percentage of Xbox 360's except Samsung is doing nothing to remedy the situation. I will never buy another Samsung product again.

Reviews.Author: Nick Robinson "Reverie"
Reviews.Content: This is based on my experiences with setup and only a little use.  I have the black, Verizon model. The box contains the phone, an impressive variety of literature, a nice set of earbuds and a wall charger.  It is packed into a well packaged box.The phone came to me with about a 50% charge.  It charged up completely in a couple of hours.  Power Up was simple! Just using a single button.  The setup was straight forward.  The S4 contains a healthy dose of Verizon-installed bloat ware, just begging for removal.  Already I'm plotting the unlock but that is for another day.Once I installed my credentials for Google Play it was a simple matter to go down the list of already owned apps and install them in their new home.  I restored a lot of my previous configuration from the Verizon Cloud Backup, which speeds up your process considerably.So far I have configured connection with my Bluetooth Kenwood car stereo, my corporate network and a.provided WiFi at a restaurant down the street.  Wifi signal reception was better than my Casio Commando but not quite as good as my wife's iPhone 4.  4g connectivity was a real pleasure as it left my old 3G as well as my wife's 4g phone in the dust.I will post more in about a week but so far I am quite pleased. Reviews.Title: Irritating Phone--Buy another phone
Reviews.Author: JS from MI
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Galaxy S4 after owning an iPhone for many years.  I liked the large screen on the phone and the ability to customize it and do things on it that cannot be done on the iPhone without unauthorized tweaks.  After several months of use and trying to get used to the S4, I have come to the conclusion that I will never buy another Samsung phone again (and I love Samsung products, just not its phones).First, with all of the features, the phone is very sluggish.  It takes several seconds after you disconnect from a call to transition to a new screen so that you can use the phone for something else or so that you can initiate another call.  The iPhone is much smoother.Second, if you are driving, it is almost impossible to quickly and easily dial a number or click on a previous call or favorite to dial.  You have to click on the name, then tap another icon.  The swipe feature absolutely stinks!  It rarely works and sometimes it engages but then disengages and does not initiate the call.  The iPhone is much better in this category.Third, the phone takes a few minutes to connect with the bluetooth in my car, so that using my car's bluetooth features with the phone is irritatingly difficult.  This was not a problem with the iPhone.Fourth, when negotiating through text messages, with the lightest touch, calls the person you received the text from.  Very annoying!Fifth, the buttons on the side of the phone are in the worst position possible.  If you are using the phone to browse the internet, read an email or watch a movie, you will most likely tap one of the side buttons (located on the length side of the phone), thereby causing the screen to go blank.  Hate this!Sixth, the calendar is not nearly as good as iPhone.Seventh, if you have office email that is not on the gmail platform and a personal gmail account, you will need two icons to access the email accounts.  The iPhone allows you to combine the emails under one icon.Eight,  the notifications for missed calls and missed text messages do not popup or show on your locked screen.  Instead, you have these little icons on the top of the screen that do not stand out well and that do not give you very specific information like who the call or text message was from.Ninth, when you have voicemails, there is no clear and obvious indication on the voice mail icon that indicates how many messages you have.  You have to click on the voice mail icon and then check to see how many voice mails you have.  The iPhone voice mail system is a lot easier and better.All in all...I recommend trying another Android phone if you like the Android platform or just get an iPhone.

Every screen it clutter.Some apps like Amazon and IMDB just seem like a mobile Internet site. Not like an app made for that phone.I could go on & on.Don't get me wrong... Reviews.Title: Oh how I hate that phone....
Reviews.Author: Leila Belhadjali
Reviews.Content: Let's see....Power button opposite the volume buttons. Really?Power button is too twitchy, the phone can't be kept in a back pocket: it will get turned off very quickly.It's too big. Yeah, I know, it seems most people want tablets, not phones, but this one is very big. It does not fit nicely in back jeans pocket, even aside from the fact that putting it there turns it off a majority of the time. have normal sized hands, and typing on this thing while it is sideways, my preferred method on my previous phone, is uncomfortable and hard to manage. Which brings me to the keyboard.The keyboard is awful. Comma, , , is on the symbols pages, and the space bar is teeny and c, b, v etc are often substituted for a space.Autocorrect? Does not exist. It does give you a selection of possibles, and you can select one of them, but that interrupts the flow of typing.As usual, and with all phones, the POS applications that you cannot delete.And most creepy/awful thing: the default-human-is-male icons you must have for your contacts (unless you upload a different image for each one). These icons are SERIOUSLY creepy looking things, male-like, and unless you have the time to devote to changing each contact, you're stuck wit them.Nanny feature: it lowers the volume on my external "headphones" every single time the jack is put back in. Give me the option of turning that feature off.Very few (three) options for the look of the messaging dialogs, all of them cluttered and clunky, and none that allows you to get rid of the creepy male faces.While the camera itself is ok (nowhere near as good as my spouse's Nokia... Starting to wish I'd gotten a Windows phone...), the interface is less than ideal: it's too easy to change cameras and getting the zoom correct takes a lot of manual dexterity.I got this phone after my 3.5 year old HTC Evo died and I wish there had been a way to replace the Evo. It seems that Samsung/Android has gotten worse over the past 3 years, the whole phone/OS feels a lot less customizable, useable, and efficient than the older combination.I'm trying to come up with something I like about the phone, to balance out the negatives and... yeah, pretty much nothing. That its a serious downgrade from a 3.5 year old phone should tell you how bad the S4 really is.

Reviews.Title: Terrible for emailing pictures
Reviews.Author: Grayjay
Reviews.Content: I have had the Galaxy S4 for a couple of weeks, and bought it largely because of the great camera.  I frequently take pictures and email them.  My wife kept complaining to me that I was sending the pictures sideways or upside down, even though they were upright in my Gallery.  Today, after a long "chat" directly with Samsung, I discovered that the phone sends the pictures in whatever orientation they happen to be, based on what direction the phone was when the picture was taken.  The Gallery adjusts them upright in the phone, but that makes no difference when you email the picture.  The only solution Samsung offers is that the recipient can edit the pictures on their end.  I had a Droid X2 for the past 3 years, and the Droid did not have this problem.  I now hate this phone, and am stuck with it.

I could not determine precisely what the issues were between the Galaxy S4 and the IMAP server, however my time of exchanging the phone for free was running out, so I just had to cut and run.Otherwise, I did like the phone overall, but without effective email support, it was not the phone for me.

Reviews.Title: US DHS and FBI warn of Android security threats - has most viruses.  not safe for banking or personal use
Reviews.Author: Hugh
Reviews.Content: Linked from The Inquirer, tech news page:  [...]THE UNITED STATES Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) must have caught up on their IT industry news reading this summer, because they have just warned about security threats to devices that use the Android mobile operating system.A joint DHS-FBI bulletin read, "Android is the world's most widely used mobile operating system (OS) and continues to be a primary target for malware attacks due to its market share and open source architecture. Industry reporting indicates 44 percent of Android users are still using versions 2.3.3 through 2.3.7 - known as Gingerbread - which were released in 2011 and have a number of security vulnerabilities that were fixed in later versions. The growing use of mobile devices by federal, state, and local authorities makes it more important than ever to keep mobile OS patched and up-to-date."The bulletin proceeded to identify SMS Trojans, rootkits and fake Google Play domains as security threats and offered various mitigation strategies.For example, to fight against SMS Trojans it advised, "Install an Android security suite designed to combat these threats. These security suites can be purchased or downloaded free from the Internet."To protect against fake domains, "Install only approved applications and follow IT department procedures to update devices' OS. Users should install and regularly update antivirus software for Android devices to detect and remove any malicious applications."The IT industry and tech-savvy users have known about these types of security concerns - stemming from Android fragmentation, most mobile phone manufacturers' sloth and indifference, and user inertia and ignorance - for a while now. But apparently the DHS and FBI just noticed this summer. µ
